original: Paṭṭhānapakaraṇa🔽Dhammānuloma (1), Tikadukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (4)
analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa  dhamma anuloma tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi
translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise🔽The Triad-duka Paṭṭhāna Text

original: 4.1. Tika Hetuduka
analyzed: tika hetu duka
translated: ... Triad, Cause Duka

original: Namo tassa Bhagavato Arahato Sammāsambuddhassa.
analyzed: namaḥ tassa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa
translated: Homage to that Blessed One, the Worthy One, the Rightly Self-awakened One.

original: 4.1.1. Kusalattika, Hetuduka
analyzed: kusalattika hetu duka
translated: ... Triad of the Wholesome, Cause Duka

original: Hetu-ārammaṇa
analyzed: hetu ārammaṇa
translated: Cause-object

original: Kusalaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca kusalo hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Akusalaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca akusalo hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: kusalam hetum dhammam paṭicca kusalaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā  akusalam hetum dhammam paṭicca akusalaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a wholesome cause as condition, a wholesome cause arises, a condition being by way of cause.🔽With an unwholesome cause as condition, an unwholesome cause arises, a condition being by way of cause.

original: Abyākataṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: abyākatam hetum dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an indeterminate cause as condition, an indeterminate cause arises, a condition being by way of cause.

original: Kusalaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca kusalo hetu dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā.🔽Akusalaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca akusalo hetu dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā.
analyzed: kusalam hetum dhammam paṭicca kusalaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā  akusalam hetum dhammam paṭicca akusalaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā
translated: With a wholesome cause as condition, a wholesome cause arises, a condition being by way of object.🔽With an unwholesome cause as condition, an unwholesome cause arises, a condition being by way of object.

original: Abyākataṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato hetu dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: abyākatam hetum dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā
translated: With an indeterminate cause as condition, an indeterminate cause arises, a condition being by way of object. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi, anantare tīṇi, samanantare tīṇi, sahajāte🔽tīṇi, aññamaññe tīṇi, nissaye tīṇi, upanissaye tīṇi, purejāte tīṇi, āsevane tīṇi,
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi anantare tīṇi samanantare tīṇi sahajāte  tīṇi aññamaññe tīṇi nissaye tīṇi upanissaye tīṇi purejāte tīṇi āsevane tīṇi
translated: With respect to cause there are three, with respect to object there are three, with respect to predominance there are three, with respect to proximity there are three, with respect to contiguity there are three, with respect to arising together there are

original: kamme tīṇi, vipāke ekaṁ, āhāre tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: kamme tīṇi vipāke eka āhāre tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: three, with respect to singleness there are three, with respect to support there are three, with respect to dependence there are three, with respect to dissociation there are three, with respect to nondisappearance there are three. (Abbreviated.)

original: Paccanīya-naadhipati🔽Kusalaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca kusalo hetu dhammo uppajjati naadhipatipaccayā.
analyzed: paccanīyana adhipati  kusalam hetum dhammam paṭicca kusalaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati na adhipati paccayā
translated: The reverse order of predominance condition🔽With a wholesome root condition there arises a wholesome root as a non-predominance condition.🔽With an unwholesome root condition there arises an unwholesome root as a non-predominance condition.

original: Akusalaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca akusalo hetu dhammo uppajjati naadhipatipaccayā.🔽Abyākataṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca abyākato hetu dhammo uppajjati naadhipatipaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: akusalam hetum dhammam paṭicca akusalaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati na adhipati paccayā  abyākatam hetum dhammam paṭicca abyākataḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati na adhipati paccayā
translated: With an indeterminate root condition there arises an indeterminate root as a non-predominance condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Naadhipatiyā tīṇi, napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, navippayutte tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na adhipatiyā tīṇi na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na vippayutte tīṇi
translated: With respect to non-predominance there are three, with respect to non-arising before there are three, with respect to non-arising after there are three, with respect to non-support there are three, with respect to non-kamma there are three, with respect to non-result there are three, with respect to non-disappearance there are three. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetupaccayā naadhipatiyā tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na adhipatiyā tīṇi
translated: With respect to cause and non-predominance there are three. (Abbreviated.)

original: Naadhipatipaccayā hetuyā tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na adhipati paccayā hetuyā tīṇi
translated: With non-dominance condition, as cause, there are three. (In brief.)

original: (Sahajātavārepi paccayavārepi nissayavārepi saṁsaṭṭhavārepi sampayuttavārepi sabbattha tīṇi.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāre pi paccaya vāre pi nissaya vāre pi sa saṭṭha vāre pi sampayutta vāre pi sabbattha tīṇi
translated: (In the section on conascence, condition, support, and combination, and in the section on association, in each case there are three.)

original: Hetu-ārammaṇādi
analyzed: hetu ārammaṇa ādi
translated: Cause, object, etc.

original: Kusalo hetu dhammo kusalassa hetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: kusalaḥ hetu dhammaḥ kusalassa hetussa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A profitable cause condition is a condition, as cause condition, for a profitable cause condition.

original: Akusalo hetu dhammo akusalassa hetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: akusalaḥ hetu dhammaḥ akusalassa hetussa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā satta, anantare pañca, samanantare pañca,🔽sahajāte tīṇi, aññamaññe tīṇi, nissaye tīṇi, upanissaye nava, āsevane tīṇi, vipāke🔽ekaṁ, indriye dve, magge dve, sampayutte tīṇi, atthiyā tīṇi, natthiyā pañca, vigate
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā satta anantare pañca samanantare pañca  sahajāte tīṇi aññamaññe tīṇi nissaye tīṇi upanissaye nava āsevane tīṇi vipāke  eka indriye dve magge dve sampayutte tīṇi atthiyā tīṇi natthiyā pañca vigate
translated: As to cause, there are three; as to object, there are nine; as to predominance, there are seven; as to proximity, there are five; as to contiguity, there are five;

analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta

analyzed: aññamaññe tīṇi nissaye terasa upanissaye nava purejāte tīṇi pacchājāte tīṇi  āsevane tīṇi kamme satta vipāke eka āhāre satta indriye satta jhāne satta  magge satta sampayutte tīṇi vippayutte pañca atthiyā terasa natthiyā satta vigate
translated: There are three in the clause “mutually dependent,” thirteen in the clause “by support,” nine in the clause “by object-predominance,” three in the clause “preceded by,” three in the clause “succeeded by,”🔽three in the clause “by nutriment,” seven in the clause “by faculty,” seven in the clause “by jhāna,”🔽seven in the clause “by path,” three in the clause “by association,” five in the clause “by dissociation,” thirteen in the clause “when present,” seven in the clause “when absent,”

original: satta, avigate terasa. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nahetuyā pannarasa, naārammaṇe pannarasa. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: satta avigate terasa saṅkhitta  na hetuyā pannarasa na ārammaṇe pannarasa saṅkhitta
translated: seven in the clause “when vanishing,” and thirteen in the clause “when non-vanishing.” (Abbreviated.)🔽Fifteen in the clause “not as root-cause,” fifteen in the clause “not as object.” (Abbreviated.)

original: Ārammaṇapaccayā nahetuyā nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: ārammaṇa paccayā na hetuyā nava
translated: Nine in the clause “as object condition, not as root-cause.” (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: Nine in the clause “as root-cause condition, not as object.” (Abbreviated.)

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvāraṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)🔽4.1.2. Vedanāttika, Hetuduka
analyzed: yathā kusala attike pañhāvāraḥ evam
translated: … as in the case of the three profitable roots.

original: Paccayacatukka
analyzed: paccaya catukka
translated: The fourfold method of conditions

original: Sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca dukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam hetum dhammam paṭicca sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā  dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttam hetum dhammam paṭicca dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A profitable root associated with pleasant feeling is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a profitable thought associated with pleasant feeling.🔽A profitable root associated with painful feeling is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a profitable thought associated with painful feeling.

original: Adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam hetum dhammam paṭicca adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A profitable root associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a profitable thought associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… vipāke dve …pe… avigate tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe vipāke dve pe avigate tīṇi
translated: As root-cause condition, three lines; as object condition, three lines; as predominance condition, three lines. … As kamma condition, two lines. … As non-disappearance condition, three lines. (Abbreviated.)

original: Naadhipatiyā tīṇi, napurejāte dve, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, navippayutte dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetupaccayā naadhipatiyā tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na adhipatiyā tīṇi na purejāte dve na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na vippayutte dve  hetu paccayāḥ na adhipatiyā tīṇi
translated: As non-predominance condition, three lines; as non-pre-arising condition, two lines; as non-post-arising condition, three lines; as non-decisive-support condition, three lines; as non-nutriment condition, three lines; as non-disappearance condition, two lines. (Abbreviated.)🔽As root-cause condition, as non-predominance condition, three lines. (Abbreviated.)

original: Naadhipatipaccayā hetuyā tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na adhipati paccayā hetuyā tīṇi
translated: As non-predominance condition, as root-cause condition, three lines. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Sahajātavārampi …pe… sampayuttavārampi vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāram pi pe sampayutta vāram pi
translated: (The section on origination should be elaborated here as in the case of the section on the root.)

original: Hetu-ārammaṇa
analyzed: hetu ārammaṇa
translated: Root Cause and Object

original: Sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto hetu dhammo sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttassa hetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.🔽Dukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto hetu dhammo dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttassa hetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ hetu dhammaḥ sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttassa hetussa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ  dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ hetu dhammaḥ dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttassa hetussa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A factor that is a root cause associated with pleasant feeling is a condition, as root cause condition, for a factor that is a root cause associated with pleasant feeling.🔽A factor that is a root cause associated with painful feeling is a condition, as root cause condition, for a factor that is a root cause associated with painful feeling.

original: Adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto hetu dhammo adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttassa hetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ hetu dhammaḥ adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttassa hetussa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A factor that is a root cause associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling is a condition, as root cause condition, for a factor that is a root cause associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling.

original: Sukhāya vedanāya sampayutto hetu dhammo sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ hetu dhammo sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A factor that is a root cause associated with pleasant feeling is a condition, as object condition, for a factor that is a root cause associated with pleasant feeling … for three.

original: Dukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto hetu dhammo dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ hetu dhammaḥ dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A factor that is a root cause associated with painful feeling is a condition, as object condition, for a factor that is a root cause associated with painful feeling … for three.

original: Adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto hetu dhammo adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā cattāri, anantare cha, samanantare cha, sahajāte🔽tīṇi, aññamaññe tīṇi, nissaye tīṇi, upanissaye nava, āsevane tīṇi, vipāke dve, indriye
analyzed: adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ hetu dhammaḥ adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi  hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā cattāri anantare cha samanantare cha sahajāte  tīṇi aññamaññe tīṇi nissaye tīṇi upanissaye nava āsevane tīṇi vipāke dve indriye
translated: A cause that is associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling is related to a cause that is associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling as object condition … (Abbreviated.)

original: dve, magge dve, sampayutte tīṇi, atthiyā tīṇi, natthiyā cha, vigate cha, avigate tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: dve magge dve sampayutte tīṇi atthiyā tīṇi natthiyā cha vigate cha avigate tīṇi
translated: In the section on cause, there are three. In the section on object, there are nine. In the section on predominance, there are four. In the section on proximity, there are six. In the section on contiguity, there are six. In the section on presence, there are three. In the section on absence, there are six. In the section on disappearance, there are six. In the section on non-disappearance, there are three. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: In the section on not a cause, there are nine. In the section on not an object, there are nine. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi
translated: In the section on cause as condition, not object, there are three. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: In the section on not a cause as condition, object, there are nine. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvāraṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: yathā kusala attike pañhāvāraḥ evam
translated: (The question section should be elaborated in the same way as in the case of the wholesome triad.)

analyzed: vipāka dhamma dhammam na hetuñca neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam na hetuñca dhammam paṭicca neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta  hetuyā terasa ārammaṇe pañca adhipatiyā nava anantare pañca samanantare pañca
translated: Dependent on a result-by-contact-nature and a non-resultant-by-contact-nature that is not a root-cause, a non-resultant-by-contact-nature that is not a root-cause arises as a root-cause condition. (In brief.)🔽There are thirteen in the root-cause section, five in the object, nine in the predominance, five in the prior, five in the proximate,

original: sahajāte terasa, aññamaññe satta, nissaye terasa, upanissaye pañca, purejāte tīṇi,
analyzed: sahajāte terasa aññamaññe satta nissaye terasa upanissaye pañca purejāte tīṇi
translated: thirteen in the conascence, seven in the post, thirteen in the support, five in the object-predominance, three in the prior,

original: āsevane dve, kamme terasa, vipāke nava, āhāre terasa …pe… sampayutte pañca …pe… avigate
analyzed: āsevane dve kamme terasa vipāke nava āhāre terasa pe sampayutte pañca pe avigate
translated: In the clause on the condition being a condition by way of decisive support, there are thirteen. In the clause on the condition being a condition by way of nutriment, there are thirteen. … In the clause on the condition being a condition by way of association, there are five. … In the clause on the condition being a condition by way of non-disappearance, there are thirteen. (Abbreviated.)

original: terasa. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: terasa
translated: (The remaining sections are to be elaborated in the same way as for the root cause condition.)

analyzed: sahajāta vāram pi pe sampayutta vāram pi paṭicca vāra sadisam
translated: (The section on origination should be elaborated in detail according to the method of the Dependent Origination.)

original: Paccayacatukka
analyzed: paccaya catukka
translated: The Four Conditions

original: Vipāko nahetu dhammo vipākassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. Vipāko🔽nahetu dhammo vipākadhammadhammassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: vipākaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ vipākassa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ vipāko  na hetu dhammaḥ vipāka dhamma dhammassa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A result that is not a cause is a condition, as object condition, for a result that is not a cause.🔽A result that is not a cause is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is a resultant and has results that is not a cause.

original: Vipāko nahetu dhammo nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.🔽Vipākadhammadhammo nahetu dhammo vipākadhammadhammassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.

translated: A result that is not a cause is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is neither a result nor a cause that is not a cause.🔽A state that is a result and has results that is not a cause is a condition, as object condition, for three …

original: Nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo nahetu dhammo nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammassa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A state that is neither a result nor a cause that is not a cause is a condition, as object condition, for three …

original: Vipāko nahetu dhammo vipākassa nahetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo … cattāri.
analyzed: vipākaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ vipākassa na hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ cattāri
translated: A result that is not a cause is a condition, as dominant condition, for four …

original: Vipākadhammadhammo nahetu dhammo vipākadhammadhammassa nahetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.🔽Nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo nahetu dhammo nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammassa nahetussa
analyzed: vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ vipāka dhamma dhammassa na hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi  neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammassa na hetussa
translated: A resultant-by-receptioon dhamma which is not a root cause is related to a resultant-by-receptioon dhamma which is not a root cause by way of pre-nascence condition … by way of decisive-support condition there are three.

original: dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo. Nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo nahetu dhammo🔽vipākassa nahetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo. Nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo
analyzed: dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ na iva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ na hetu dhammo  vipākassa na hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ na iva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammo
translated: A neither-resultant-nor-resultant-by-receptioon dhamma which is not a root cause is related to a neither-resultant-nor-resultant-by-receptioon dhamma which is not a root cause by way of pre-nascence condition … by way of decisive-support condition there are three.

original: nahetu dhammo vipākadhammadhammassa nahetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.🔽Vipāko nahetu dhammo vipākassa nahetussa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo … dve.
analyzed: na hetu dhammaḥ vipāka dhamma dhammassa na hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi  vipākaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ vipākassa na hetussa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ dve
translated: A neither-resultant-nor-resultant-by-receptioon dhamma which is not a root cause is related to a resultant dhamma which is not a root cause by way of pre-nascence condition … by way of decisive-support condition there are three.🔽A resultant dhamma which is not a root cause is related to a resultant dhamma which is not a root cause by way of pre-nascence condition … by way of proximity condition … by way of contiguity condition … by way of immediacy condition … by way of decisive-support condition … by way of object condition … by way of predominance condition there are two.

original: Vipākadhammadhammo nahetu dhammo vipākadhammadhammassa nahetussa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo … dve.
analyzed: vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ vipāka dhamma dhammassa na hetussa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ dve

original: Nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo nahetu dhammo nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammassa nahetussa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammassa na hetussa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi saṅkhitta
translated: A non-resultant-by-contact and a non-result-producing-by-contact idea is related to a non-resultant-by-contact and a non-result-producing-by-contact idea that is not a root-cause as next-to-last condition … three. (Abbreviated.)

original: Ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā dasa, anantare satta, samanantare satta, sahajāte ekādasa,🔽aññamaññe satta, nissaye terasa, upanissaye nava, āsevane dve, kamme nava, vipāke
analyzed: ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā dasa anantare satta samanantare satta sahajāte ekādasa  aññamaññe satta nissaye terasa upanissaye nava āsevane dve kamme nava vipāke
translated: In the object nine, in the predominance ten, in the proximity seven, in the contiguity seven, in the kamma-concomitance eleven,🔽in the dependence seven, in the support thirteen, in the decisive support nine, in the prenascence seven, in the postnascence seven, in the repetition two, in the kamma nine,

original: tīṇi, āhāre satta, indriye nava, jhāne satta, magge satta, sampayutte tīṇi, vippayutte🔽pañca, atthiyā terasa …pe… avigate terasa. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nahetuyā soḷasa, naārammaṇe soḷasa. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)

translated: in the nutriment seven, in the faculty nine, in the jhana seven, in the path seven, in the association three, in the dissociation

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽(Yathā kusalattike pañhāvāraṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)🔽4.1.4. Upādinnattika, Hetuduka🔽Paccayacatukka

original: Upādinnupādāniyaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca upādinnupādāniyo hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Anupādinnupādāniyaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anupādinnupādāniyo hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: upādinnupādāniyam hetum dhammam paṭicca upādinnupādāniyaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā  anupādinnupādāniyam hetum dhammam paṭicca anupādinnupādāniyaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A causally arisen, causally induced phenomenon is related to a causally arisen, causally induced phenomenon by way of root-cause condition.🔽A causally arisen, causally uninduced phenomenon is related to a causally arisen, causally uninduced phenomenon by way of root-cause condition.

original: Anupādinnaanupādāniyaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anupādinnaanupādāniyo hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: anupādinna anupādāniyam hetum dhammam paṭicca anupādinna anupādāniyaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A causally unarisen, causally uninduced phenomenon is related to a causally unarisen, causally uninduced phenomenon by way of root-cause condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe tīṇi, adhipatiyā dve …pe… vipāke dve …pe… avigate tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Naadhipatiyā tīṇi, napurejāte tīṇi …pe… naāsevane tīṇi, navipāke dve, navippayutte tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā dve pe vipāke dve pe avigate tīṇi  na adhipatiyā tīṇi na purejāte tīṇi pe na āsevane tīṇi na vipāke dve na vippayutte tīṇi
translated: In the case of root-cause, there are three; in the case of object, there are three; in the case of predominance, there are two … In the case of kamma result, there are two … In the case of non-disappearance, there are three. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Sahajātavārampi …pe… sampayuttavārampi vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāram pi pe sampayutta vāram pi
translated: In the case of non-predominance, there are three; in the case of non-decisive support, there are three … In the case of non-contention, there are three; in the case of non-wastefulness, there are three; in the case of the path, there are three; in the case of the way, there are three; in the case of non-causality, there are three; in the case of non-retribution, there are two; in the case of non-relation, there are three. (Abbreviated.)🔽(The section on the origination of the causally arisen should be expanded in detail as in the case of the causally arisen.)

original: Paccayacatukka
analyzed: paccaya catukka
translated: The four conditions

original: Upādinnupādāniyo hetu dhammo upādinnupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: upādinnupādāniyaḥ hetu dhammaḥ upādinnupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A causally arisen, causally induced phenomenon is related to a causally arisen, causally induced phenomenon by way of root-cause condition.

original: Anupādinnupādāniyo hetu dhammo anupādinnupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.🔽Anupādinnaanupādāniyo hetu dhammo anupādinnaanupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: anupādinnupādāniyaḥ hetu dhammaḥ anupādinnupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ  anupādinna anupādāniyaḥ hetu dhammaḥ anupādinna anupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A causally-conditioned and clung-to root-cause is related to a causally-conditioned and clung-to root-cause as a root-cause condition.🔽A causally-unconditioned and unclung-to root-cause is related to a causally-unconditioned and unclung-to root-cause as a root-cause condition.

original: Upādinnupādāniyo hetu dhammo upādinnupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: upādinnupādāniyaḥ hetu dhammaḥ upādinnupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: A causally-compounded, causally-acquired root-cause is related to a causally-compounded, causally-acquired root-cause by way of root-cause condition.🔽A causally-compounded, causally-unacquired root-cause is related to a causally-compounded, causally-unacquired root-cause by way of root-cause condition.

original: paccayo. Upādinnupādāniyo hetu dhammo anupādinnupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccayaḥ upādinnupādāniyaḥ hetu dhammaḥ anupādinnupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A causally-compounded, causally-acquired root-cause is related to a causally-compounded, causally-acquired root-cause by way of object condition.

original: Anupādinnupādāniyo hetu dhammo anupādinnupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena🔽paccayo. Anupādinnupādāniyo hetu dhammo upādinnupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: anupādinnupādāniyaḥ hetu dhammaḥ anupādinnupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena  paccayaḥ anupādinnupādāniyaḥ hetu dhammaḥ upādinnupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A causally-compounded, causally-acquired root-cause is related to a causally-compounded, causally-unacquired root-cause by way of object condition.🔽A causally-compounded, causally-unacquired root-cause is related to a causally-compounded, causally-unacquired root-cause by way of object condition.

original: Anupādinnaanupādāniyo hetu dhammo anupādinnupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: anupādinna anupādāniyaḥ hetu dhammaḥ anupādinnupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A causally-compounded, causally-unacquired root-cause is related to a causally-compounded, causally-acquired root-cause by way of object condition.🔽A causally-uncompounded, causally-unacquired root-cause is related to a causally-uncompounded, causally-unacquired root-cause by way of object condition.

original: Upādinnupādāniyo hetu dhammo anupādinnupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo.🔽Anupādinnupādāniyo hetu dhammo anupādinnupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: upādinnupādāniyaḥ hetu dhammaḥ anupādinnupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ  anupādinnupādāniyaḥ hetu dhammaḥ anupādinnupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A causally arisen, causally induced object is a condition, by way of predominance condition, for a causally arisen, causally induced object.🔽A causally arisen, causally un-induced object is a condition, by way of predominance condition, for a causally arisen, causally un-induced object.

original: Anupādinnaanupādāniyo hetu dhammo anupādinnaanupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena🔽paccayo. Anupādinnaanupādāniyo hetu dhammo anupādinnupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa
analyzed: anupādinna anupādāniyaḥ hetu dhammaḥ anupādinna anupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena  paccayaḥ anupādinna anupādāniyaḥ hetu dhammaḥ anupādinnupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa
translated: A causally un-arisen, causally un-induced object is a condition, by way of predominance condition, for a causally un-arisen, causally un-induced object.

original: adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A causally un-arisen, causally un-induced object is a condition, by way of predominance condition, for a causally arisen, causally un-induced object.

original: Anantara-upanissaya🔽Upādinnupādāniyo hetu dhammo upādinnupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: anantara aupanissaya  upādinnupādāniyaḥ hetu dhammaḥ upādinnupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Immediate-support🔽A causally arisen, causally induced object is a condition, by way of immediate-proximity condition, for a causally arisen, causally induced object.

original: Anupādinnupādāniyo hetu dhammo anupādinnupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: anupādinnupādāniyaḥ hetu dhammaḥ anupādinnupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A causally arisen, causally un-induced object is a condition, by way of immediate-proximity condition, for a causally arisen, causally un-induced object. … three.

original: Anupādinnaanupādāniyo hetu dhammo anupādinnaanupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa anantarapaccayena
analyzed: anupādinna anupādāniyaḥ hetu dhammaḥ anupādinna anupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa anantara paccayena
translated: A causally-conditioned and not-subject-to-retrogressing cause is related to a causally-conditioned and not-subject-to-retrogressing cause by way of the condition being due to arising immediately in proximate relationship.

original: paccayo. Anupādinnaanupādāniyo hetu dhammo upādinnupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa🔽anantarapaccayena paccayo …pe….
analyzed: paccayaḥ anupādinna anupādāniyaḥ hetu dhammaḥ upādinnupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa  anantara paccayena paccayaḥ pe
translated: A causally-conditioned and not-subject-to-retrogressing cause is related to a causally-conditioned and subject-to-retrogressing cause by way of the condition being due to arising immediately in proximate relationship.

original: Upādinnupādāniyo hetu dhammo upādinnupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena🔽paccayo. Upādinnupādāniyo hetu dhammo anupādinnupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena
analyzed: upādinnupādāniyaḥ hetu dhammaḥ upādinnupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena  paccayaḥ upādinnupādāniyaḥ hetu dhammaḥ anupādinnupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena
translated: A causally-conditioned and subject-to-retrogressing cause is related to a causally-conditioned and subject-to-retrogressing cause by way of the condition being due to decisive support.🔽A causally-conditioned and subject-to-retrogressing cause is related to a causally-conditioned and not-subject-to-retrogressing cause by way of the condition being due to decisive support.🔽A causally-conditioned and subject-to-retrogressing cause is related to a causally-unconditioned and not-subject-to-retrogressing cause by way of the condition being due to decisive support.

original: paccayo. Upādinnupādāniyo hetu dhammo anupādinnaanupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa🔽upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccayaḥ upādinnupādāniyaḥ hetu dhammaḥ anupādinna anupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa  upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A causally-unconditioned and not-subject-to-retrogressing cause is related to a causally-unconditioned and not-subject-to-retrogressing cause by way of the condition being due to decisive support.🔽A causally-unconditioned and not-subject-to-retrogressing cause is related to a causally-conditioned and not-subject-to-retrogressing cause by way of the condition being due to decisive support.🔽A causally-unconditioned and not-subject-to-retrogressing cause is related to a causally-conditioned and subject-to-retrogressing cause by way of the condition being due to decisive support.

original: Anupādinnupādāniyo hetu dhammo anupādinnupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: anupādinnupādāniyaḥ hetu dhammaḥ anupādinnupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A causally-unconditioned and not-subject-to-retrogressing cause is related to a causally-conditioned and subject-to-retrogressing cause by way of the condition being due to decisive support.

original: Anupādinnaanupādāniyo hetu dhammo anupādinnaanupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe pañca, adhipatiyā cattāri, anantare cha, samanantare cha, sahajāte🔽tīṇi, aññamaññe tīṇi, nissaye tīṇi, upanissaye nava, āsevane dve, vipāke dve …pe…
analyzed: anupādinna anupādāniyaḥ hetu dhammaḥ anupādinna anupādāniyassa hetussa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi  hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe pañca adhipatiyā cattāri anantare cha samanantare cha sahajāte  tīṇi aññamaññe tīṇi nissaye tīṇi upanissaye nava āsevane dve vipāke dve pe
translated: A condition by way of decisive support condition is a condition, as decisive support condition, for three. (Abbreviated.)

original: indriye magge sampayutte tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe pañca. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: indriye magge sampayutte tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta  hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi  na hetu paccayāḥ ārammaṇe pañca saṅkhitta
translated: In the case of root cause there are three, in the case of object there are five, in the case of predominance there are four, in the case of proximity there are six, in the case of contiguity there are six, in the case of immediacy there are six, in the case of repetition there are six, in the case of kamma there are six, in the case of nutriment there are four, in the case of faculty there are four, in the case of jhāna there are four, in the case of path there are four, in the case of association there are three, in the case of dissociation there are three, in the case of presence there are three, in the case of absence there are three, in the case of disappearance there are three, in the case of non-disappearance there are three, in the case of the requisite of this there are three, in the case of the condition there are three, in the case of the unincluded there are three. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvāraṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)🔽Paccayacatukka
analyzed: yathā kusala attike pañhāvāraḥ evam  paccaya catukka
translated: In the case of root cause there are three, in the case of object there are five, in the case of predominance there are four, in the case of proximity there are six, in the case of contiguity there are six, in the case of immediacy there are six, in the case of repetition there are six, in the case of kamma there are six, in the case of nutriment there are four, in the case of faculty there are four, in the case of jhāna there are four, in the case of path there are four, in the case of association there are three, in the case of dissociation there are three, in the case of presence there are three, in the case of absence there are three, in the case of disappearance there are three, in the case of non-disappearance there are three, in the case of the requisite of this there are three, in the case of the condition there are three, in the case of the unincluded there are three. (Abbreviated.)

analyzed: upādinnupādāniyam na hetum dhammam paṭicca upādinnupādāniyaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati

translated: With non-causality as condition: a non-causality that is not subject to cankers arises.🔽With non-causality as condition: a non-causality that is subject to cankers arises.🔽With non-causality as condition: a non-causality that is subject to cankers and a non-causality that is not subject to cankers arise.🔽With non-causality as condition: a non-causality that is not subject to cankers arises.

original: Upādinnupādāniyaṁ nahetuñca anupādinnupādāniyaṁ nahetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca anupādinnupādāniyo nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Anupādinnupādāniyaṁ nahetuñca anupādinnaanupādāniyaṁ nahetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca anupādinnupādāniyo nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: upādinnupādāniyam na hetuñca anupādinnupādāniyam na hetuñca dhammam paṭicca anupādinnupādāniyaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā  anupādinnupādāniyam na hetuñca anupādinna anupādāniyam na hetuñca dhammam paṭicca anupādinnupādāniyaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an object that is clung-to and has no root cause, and with an object that is not clung-to and has no root cause, a conditionally arisen object that is not clung-to and has no root cause arises.🔽With an object that is not clung-to and has no root cause, and with an object that is not clung-to and has no root cause, a conditionally arisen object that is not clung-to and has no root cause arises.

original: Upādinnupādāniyaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca upādinnupādāniyo nahetu dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā.
analyzed: upādinnupādāniyam na hetum dhammam paṭicca upādinnupādāniyaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā
translated: With an object that is clung-to and has no root cause, a conditionally arisen object that is clung-to and has no root cause arises.

original: Anupādinnupādāniyaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anupādinnupādāniyo nahetu dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā.
analyzed: anupādinnupādāniyam na hetum dhammam paṭicca anupādinnupādāniyaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā
translated: With an object that is not clung-to and has no root cause, a conditionally arisen object that is not clung-to and has no root cause arises.

original: Anupādinnaanupādāniyaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anupādinnaanupādāniyo nahetu dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: anupādinna anupādāniyam na hetum dhammam paṭicca anupādinna anupādāniyaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: With an object that is not clung-to and has no root cause, a conditionally arisen object that is not clung-to and has no root cause arises. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe tīṇi, adhipatiyā pañca, anantare tīṇi, samanantare tīṇi, sahajāte
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā pañca anantare tīṇi samanantare tīṇi sahajāte
translated: With a cause, nine; with an object, three; with predominance, five; with proximity, three; with contiguity, three; with arising together,

original: nava, aññamaññe tīṇi, nissaye nava, upanissaye tīṇi, purejāte tīṇi, āsevane dve,
analyzed: nava aññamaññe tīṇi nissaye nava upanissaye tīṇi purejāte tīṇi āsevane dve
translated: nine, three in the other two ways, nine in the decisive-support, three in the support, three in the prenascence, two in the conascence,

original: kamme nava, vipāke nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: kamme nava vipāke nava pe avigate nava
translated: nine in the kamma, nine in the result, … (in the other two ways) … nine in the indeterminate. (In brief)

original: Nahetu🔽Upādinnupādāniyaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca upādinnupādāniyo nahetu dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: na hetu  upādinnupādāniyam na hetum dhammam paṭicca upādinnupādāniyaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With non-cause as condition

original: Anupādinnupādāniyaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anupādinnupādāniyo nahetu dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā.🔽Upādinnupādāniyaṁ nahetuñca anupādinnupādāniyaṁ nahetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca anupādinnupādāniyo nahetu dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: anupādinnupādāniyam na hetum dhammam paṭicca anupādinnupādāniyaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā  upādinnupādāniyam na hetuñca anupādinnupādāniyam na hetuñca dhammam paṭicca anupādinnupādāniyaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā
translated: With a non-cause that is clung to as condition there arises what is clung to that is a non-cause. With a non-cause that is not clung to as condition there arises what is not clung to that is a non-cause.🔽With a non-cause that is clung to and what is not clung to as condition there arises what is not clung to that is a non-cause. (In brief)🔽With a non-cause as object … With a non-cause as prenascence … With a non-cause as postnascence … With a non-cause as nutriment … With a non-cause as faculty … With a non-cause as jhāna … With a non-cause as path … With a non-cause as association …

original: Nahetuyā pañca, naārammaṇe cha …pe… napurejāte satta, napacchājāte naāsevane nava,🔽nakamme dve, navipāke cha, naāhāre naindriye najhāne dve, namagge pañca, nasampayutte
analyzed: na hetuyā pañca na ārammaṇe cha pe na purejāte satta na pacchājāte na āsevane nava 🔽na kamme dve na vipāke cha na āhāre na indriye na jhāne dve na magge pañca na sampayutte
translated: With a non-cause as non-causality …

original: cha, navippayutte tīṇi …pe… novigate cha. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: cha na vippayutte tīṇi pe no vigate cha
translated: … with the non-disappeared as condition, three … … with the non-transcended as condition, six. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe cha. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe cha saṅkhitta
translated: With the cause as condition, not as object, six. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe dve
translated: With the non-cause as condition, as object, two. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvāraṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: yathā kusala attike pañhāvāraḥ evam
translated: … (The section on the questions should be expanded as for the wholesome triad.)

original: 4.1.5. Saṅkiliṭṭhattika, Hetuduka
analyzed: saṅkiliṭṭhattika hetuduka
translated: The Corrupted Triad, the Cause Section

original: Paccayacatukka
analyzed: paccaya catukka
translated: The Conditions Quartet

original: Saṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesikaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikam hetum dhammam paṭicca saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a corrupted and corrupted cause as condition, a corrupted and corrupted dhamma arises.

original: Asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesikaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: asaṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikam hetum dhammam paṭicca asaṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an uncorrupted and corrupted cause as condition, an uncorrupted and corrupted dhamma arises.

original: Asaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesikaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca asaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesiko hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: asaṅkiliṭṭha asaṅkilesikam hetum dhammam paṭicca asaṅkiliṭṭha asaṅkilesikaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: With an uncorrupted and uncorrupted cause as condition, an uncorrupted and uncorrupted dhamma arises. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe tīṇi …pe… vipāke dve …pe… avigate tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe tīṇi pe vipāke dve pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With the cause as condition, three; with the object as condition, three; … with the result as condition, two; … with the unincluded as condition, three. (Abbreviated.)

original: Naadhipatiyā tīṇi, napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, navippayutte tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) (Sahajātavārampi …pe… sampayuttavārampi vitthāretabbaṁ.)🔽Hetu-ārammaṇādi🔽Saṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko hetu dhammo saṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesikassa hetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: na adhipatiyā tīṇi na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na vippayutte tīṇi saṅkhitta sahajāta vārampi pe sampayutta vārampi vitthāretabba  hetu ārammaṇa ādi  saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ hetu dhammaḥ saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikassa hetussa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: With respect to the dominant condition, there are three. With respect to the prenascence condition, there are three. With respect to the postnascence condition, there are three. With respect to the nutriment condition, there are three. With respect to the faculty condition, there are three. With respect to the association condition, there are three. With respect to the presence condition, there are three. With respect to the absence condition, there are three. With respect to the dissociation condition, there are three. With respect to the non-dissociation condition, there are three. (The rest is abridged.) (The section on the origination through the connection with the origination condition should be expanded in detail.)

original: Asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko hetu dhammo asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesikassa hetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.🔽Asaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesiko hetu dhammo asaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesikassa hetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: asaṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ hetu dhammaḥ asaṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikassa hetussa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ  asaṅkiliṭṭha asaṅkilesikaḥ hetu dhammaḥ asaṅkiliṭṭha asaṅkilesikassa hetussa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Root, object, etc.🔽A defiled-corrupted root cause is a condition, as root cause condition, for a defiled-corrupted root cause.🔽A undefiled-uncorrupted root cause is a condition, as root cause condition, for a undefiled-uncorrupted root cause.🔽A undefiled-uncorrupted root cause is a condition, as root cause condition, for a undefiled-uncorrupted root cause.

original: Saṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko hetu dhammo saṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesikassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … dve.
analyzed: saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ hetu dhammo saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ dve
translated: A defiled-corrupted root cause is a condition, as object condition, for a defiled-corrupted root cause. … two.

original: Asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko hetu dhammo asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesikassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … dve.
analyzed: asaṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ hetu dhammaḥ asaṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ dve
translated: A cause that is not corrupted and is not subject to corruption is related to a cause that is not corrupted and is not subject to corruption as object condition … two.

original: Asaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesiko hetu dhammo asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesikassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.

translated: A cause that is not corrupted and is not subject to corruption is related to a cause that is not corrupted and is not subject to corruption as object condition.

translated: A cause that is not corrupted and is not subject to corruption is related to a cause that is not corrupted and is not subject to corruption as predominance condition. A cause that is not corrupted and is not subject to corruption is related to a cause that is corrupted and is subject to corruption as predominance condition.

original: Asaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesiko hetu dhammo asaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesikassa hetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo … dve.

translated: A cause that is not corrupted and is not subject to corruption is related to a cause that is not corrupted and is not subject to corruption as predominance condition … two.

analyzed: saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ hetu dhammo saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikassa hetussa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ cha pe  saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ hetu dhammo saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikassa hetussa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena  paccayaḥ saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ hetu dhammaḥ a saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikassa hetussa dhammassa
translated: A defiled-and-corrupted cause is related to a defiled-and-corrupted cause as an immediately preceding condition … six …

original: upanissayapaccayena paccayo. Saṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko hetu dhammo asaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesikassa🔽hetussa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo.🔽Asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko hetu dhammo asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesikassa hetussa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.

translated: A defiled-and-corrupted cause is related to a defiled-and-corrupted cause as a decisive support condition. A defiled-and-corrupted cause is related to an undefiled-and-corrupted cause as a decisive support condition. A defiled-and-corrupted cause is related to an undefiled-and-uncorrupted cause as a decisive support condition.🔽An undefiled-and-corrupted cause is related to an undefiled-and-corrupted cause as a decisive support condition … three.

original: Asaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesiko hetu dhammo asaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesikassa hetussa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo … dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: asaṅkiliṭṭha asaṅkilesikaḥ hetu dhammaḥ asaṅkiliṭṭha asaṅkilesikassa hetussa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ dve
translated: An undefiled-and-uncorrupted cause is related to an undefiled-and-uncorrupted cause as a decisive support condition … two. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe pañca, adhipatiyā pañca, anantare cha, samanantare cha, sahajāte
analyzed: tīṇi ārammaṇe pañca adhipatiyā pañca anantare cha samanantare cha sahajāte
translated: With respect to cause there are three, with respect to object there are five, with respect to predominance there are five, with respect to proximity there are six, with respect to contiguity there are six, with respect to arising together there are

original: tīṇi, aññamaññe tīṇi, nissaye tīṇi, upanissaye aṭṭha, āsevane tīṇi, vipāke dve, indriye
analyzed: tīṇi aññamaññe tīṇi nissaye tīṇi upanissaye aṭṭha āsevane tīṇi vipāke dve indriye
translated: three, with respect to presence there are three, with respect to non-disappearance there are three, with respect to kamma there are three, with respect to nutriment there are three, with respect to faculty there are

original: dve, magge dve, sampayutte tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: dve magge dve sampayutte tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: two, with respect to path there are two, with respect to association there are three … and so on as in § 101 … with respect to absence there are three. (In brief)

original: Nahetuyā aṭṭha, naārammaṇe aṭṭha. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā aṭṭha na ārammaṇe aṭṭha saṅkhitta
translated: With respect to non-cause there are eight, with respect to non-object there are eight. (In brief)

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi
translated: With respect to cause as condition, with respect to non-object there are three. (In brief)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe pañca. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayāḥ ārammaṇe pañca saṅkhitta
translated: With respect to non-cause as condition, with respect to object there are five. (In brief)

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvāraṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: yathā kusala attike pañhāvāraḥ evam
translated: As in the case of the three triads of the wholesome, this section should be expanded in detail.

original: Paccayacatukka🔽Saṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesikaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko nahetu dhammo
analyzed: paccaya catukka  saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikam na hetum dhammam paṭicca saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ

analyzed: uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikam na hetum dhammam paṭicca a saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ

A causally-related state that is corrupt and subject to corruption, with no cause, is a condition, as condition by way of cause, for a causally-related state that is not corrupt and subject to corruption, with no cause.

original: nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Saṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesikaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca🔽saṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko nahetu ca asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko nahetu ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.

translated: A defiled condition that is not a root-cause arises with a root-cause as condition.

original: Asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesikaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Asaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesikaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca asaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesiko nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.

translated: A defiled and a pure condition that are not root-causes arise with a root-cause as condition.🔽A pure condition that is not a root-cause arises with a root-cause as condition.🔽A pure and an undefiled condition that are not root-causes arise with a root-cause as condition.

original: Saṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesikaṁ nahetuñca asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesikaṁ nahetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.

translated: A defiled and a pure condition that are not root-causes arise with a root-cause as condition.

original: Asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesikaṁ nahetuñca asaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesikaṁ nahetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Saṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesikaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko nahetu dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā.

translated: With a non-defiled-non-corrupted, not-having-as-its-sign-corrupted, root-cause not-having-as-its-sign-corrupted, root-cause dhamma as condition, a non-defiled-non-corrupted, not-having-as-its-sign-corrupted, root-cause not-having-as-its-sign-corrupted, root-cause dhamma arises.🔽With a defiled-corrupted, root-cause not-having-as-its-sign-corrupted, root-cause dhamma as condition, a defiled-corrupted, root-cause not-having-as-its-sign-corrupted, root-cause dhamma arises. (Abbreviated.)

original: Asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesikaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko nahetu dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā.

original: Asaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesikaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca asaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesiko nahetu dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)

translated: With a non-defiled-non-corrupted, not-having-as-its-sign-corrupted, root-cause not-having-as-its-sign-corrupted, root-cause dhamma as condition, a non-defiled-non-corrupted, not-having-as-its-sign-corrupted, root-cause not-having-as-its-sign-corrupted, root-cause dhamma arises. original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe tīṇi, adhipatiyā nava, anantare tīṇi, samanantare tīṇi, sahajāte
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā nava anantare tīṇi samanantare tīṇi sahajāte
translated: With a root-cause as condition there are nine. With an object as condition there are three. With predominance as condition there are nine. With an immediately prior condition there are three. With a similar and immediately prior condition there are three. With co-nascence there are

original: nava, aññamaññe tīṇi, nissaye nava, upanissaye tīṇi, purejāte tīṇi, āsevane tīṇi,
analyzed: nava aññamaññe tīṇi nissaye nava upanissaye tīṇi purejāte tīṇi āsevane tīṇi
translated: nine. With dependence there are nine. With nutriment there are three. With a prenascence there are three. With post-nascence there are three. With repetition there are three.🔽With non-repetition there are three.

original: kamme nava, vipāke pañca, āhāre nava …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: kamme nava vipāke pañca āhāre nava pe avigate nava
translated: with nine kinds of kamma, with five kinds of result, with nine kinds of nutriment, and so on. (In detail as in Text X.1, but with the words “with cause” omitted.)

original: Nahetu
analyzed: na hetu
translated: With no cause as condition

translated: A state that is neither a root nor a defilement nor a form has no cause as a condition. (In brief.)

translated: With no object as condition … With no predominance as condition … With no prior condition … With no arising before as condition … With no disappearance as condition … With no proximity as condition … With no Arousal as condition … With no persistence as condition … With no repetition as condition … With no non-arising as condition … With no non-persistence as condition … With no non-arising-before-now as condition … With no kamma as condition … With no result as condition … With no nutriment as condition … With no faculty as condition … With no jhāna as condition … With no path as condition … With no fruition as condition … With no cessation as condition … With no non-restraint as condition … With no non-path as condition … With no non-fruition as condition … With no non-cessation as condition … With no non-defeat as condition … With no non-disappearance as condition … With no non-restraint as condition … With no non-obtaining as condition … With no non-possession as condition … With no non-arising as condition … With no non-disappearance as condition … With no non-obtaining as condition … With no non-possession as condition … With no non-arising as condition … With no non-disappearance as condition … With no non-obtaining as condition … With no non-possession as condition … With no non-arising as condition … With no non-disappearance as condition … With no non-obtaining as condition … With no non-possession as condition … With no non-arising as condition … With no non-disappearance as condition … With no non-obtaining as condition … With no non-possession as condition … With no non-arising as condition … With no non-disappearance as condition … With no non-obtaining as condition … With no non-possession as condition … With no non-arising as condition … With no non-disappearance as condition … With no non-obtaining as condition … With no non-possession as condition … With no non-arising as condition

original: Asaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesiko nahetu dhammo asaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesikassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … dve.
analyzed: asaṅkiliṭṭha asaṅkilesikaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ asaṅkiliṭṭha asaṅkilesikassa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ dve
translated: A not-defiled-nor-undefiled condition, not a root condition, is related to a not-defiled-nor-undefiled condition, not a root condition, as object condition … two.

original: Saṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko nahetu dhammo saṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesikassa nahetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ saṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikassa na hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A defiled-and-undefiled condition, not a root condition, is related to a defiled-and-undefiled condition, not a root condition, as predominance condition … three.

original: Asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesiko nahetu dhammo asaṅkiliṭṭhasaṅkilesikassa nahetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo … dve.
analyzed: asaṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ asaṅkiliṭṭha saṅkilesikassa na hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ dve
translated: A not-defiled-and-undefiled condition, not a root condition, is related to a not-defiled-and-undefiled condition, not a root condition, as predominance condition … two.

original: Asaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesiko nahetu dhammo asaṅkiliṭṭhaasaṅkilesikassa nahetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: asaṅkiliṭṭha asaṅkilesikaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ asaṅkiliṭṭha asaṅkilesikassa na hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi saṅkhitta
translated: A not-defiled-nor-undefiled condition, not a root condition, is related to a not-defiled-nor-undefiled condition, not a root condition, as predominance condition … three. (Abbreviated.)

original: Ārammaṇe cha, adhipatiyā aṭṭha, anantare satta, samanantare satta, sahajāte nava,
analyzed: ārammaṇe cha adhipatiyā aṭṭha anantare satta samanantare satta sahajāte nava
translated: As object, six; as predominance, eight; as proximity, seven; as proximity and contiguity, seven; as conascence, nine;

analyzed: aññamaññe tīṇi nissaye terasa upanissaye aṭṭha āsevane tīṇi kamme satta vipāke

analyzed: ārammaṇa paccayāḥ na hetuyā cha saṅkhitta

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: There are three lines of three in regard to cause and object, … in regard to non-hindrance. (Abbreviated.)

original: Naadhipatiyā tīṇi, napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, navippayutte tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)

translated: (As in the section on conascence, so in the section on relation, too, the method of treatment should be understood.)

original: Paccayacatukka
analyzed: paccaya catukka
translated: The Fourfold Dependent Origination

original: Savitakkasavicāro hetu dhammo savitakkasavicārassa hetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.🔽Avitakkavicāramatto hetu dhammo avitakkavicāramattassa hetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.🔽Avitakkaavicāro hetu dhammo avitakkaavicārassa hetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
