translated: A factor that is with-conveying-thought-and-restraint is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a factor that is with-conveying-thought-and-restraint.🔽A factor that is without-conveying-thought-and-restraint is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a factor that is without-conveying-thought-and-restraint.

original: Savitakkasavicāro hetu dhammo savitakkasavicārassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ hetu dhammo sa vitakka sa vicārassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: A factor that is with-conveying-thought-and-restraint is a condition, as object condition, for a factor that is with-conveying-thought-and-restraint.

original: paccayo. Savitakkasavicāro hetu dhammo avitakkaavicārassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.🔽Avitakkavicāramatto hetu dhammo savitakkasavicārassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: paccayaḥ sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ hetu dhammaḥ avitakka avicārassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ  avitakka vicāra mattaḥ hetu dhammo sa vitakka sa vicārassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: Condition. A factor that is with thought and with investigation is a condition for a factor that is without thought and without investigation as a condition by way of object condition.🔽A factor that is without thought and with investigation is a condition for a factor that is with thought and with investigation as a condition by way of object condition.

original: paccayo. Avitakkavicāramatto hetu dhammo avitakkaavicārassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.🔽Avitakkaavicāro hetu dhammo avitakkaavicārassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: paccayaḥ avitakka vicāra mattaḥ hetu dhammaḥ avitakka avicārassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ  avitakka avicāraḥ hetu dhammo avitakka avicārassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: A factor that is without thought and with investigation is a condition for a factor that is without thought and without investigation as a condition by way of object condition.🔽A factor that is without thought and without investigation is a condition for a factor that is without thought and without investigation as a condition by way of object condition.

original: paccayo. Avitakkaavicāro hetu dhammo savitakkasavicārassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccayaḥ avitakka avicāraḥ hetu dhammo sa vitakka sa vicārassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A factor that is without thought and without investigation is a condition for a factor that is with thought and with investigation as a condition by way of object condition.

original: Savitakkasavicāro hetu dhammo savitakkasavicārassa hetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ hetu dhammo sa vitakka sa vicārassa hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayo
translated: A factor that is with thought and with investigation is a condition for a factor that is with thought and with investigation as a condition by way of predominance condition.

original: Avitakkavicāramatto hetu dhammo avitakkavicāramattassa hetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena
analyzed: a vitakka vicāra mattaḥ hetu dhammaḥ a vitakka vicāra mattassa hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena
translated: A factor that is without thought and with investigation is a condition for a factor that is without thought and with investigation as a condition by way of predominance condition.

original: paccayo. Avitakkavicāramatto hetu dhammo savitakkasavicārassa hetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo.🔽Avitakkaavicāro hetu dhammo avitakkaavicārassa hetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena
analyzed: paccayaḥ avitakka vicāra mattaḥ hetu dhammo sa vitakka sa vicārassa hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ  avitakka avicāraḥ hetu dhammaḥ avitakka avicārassa hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena
translated: A cause that is without thought and with only investigation is a condition, by way of predominance condition, for a cause that is with thought and with investigation.🔽A cause that is without thought and without investigation is a condition, by way of predominance condition, for a cause that is without thought and without investigation.

original: paccayo. Avitakkaavicāro hetu dhammo savitakkasavicārassa hetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo.🔽Savitakkasavicāro hetu dhammo savitakkasavicārassa hetussa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.🔽Avitakkavicāramatto hetu dhammo avitakkavicāramattassa hetussa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: paccayaḥ avitakka avicāraḥ hetu dhammo sa vitakka sa vicārassa hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ  sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ hetu dhammo sa vitakka sa vicārassa hetussa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi  a vitakka vicāra mattaḥ hetu dhammaḥ a vitakka vicāra mattassa hetussa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A cause that is without thought and without investigation is a condition, by way of predominance condition, for a cause that is with thought and with investigation.🔽A cause that is with thought and with investigation is a condition, by way of immediately preceding condition, for three …🔽A cause that is without thought and with only investigation is a condition, by way of immediately preceding condition, for three …

original: Avitakkaavicāro hetu dhammo avitakkaavicārassa hetussa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi …pe….
analyzed: avitakka avicāraḥ hetu dhammaḥ avitakka avicārassa hetussa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi pe
translated: A cause that is without thought and without investigation is a condition, by way of immediately preceding condition, for three … and so on.

original: Savitakkasavicāro hetu dhammo savitakkasavicārassa hetussa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo … nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ hetu dhammo sa vitakka sa vicārassa hetussa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ nava
translated: A factor that is with applied-thought and sustained-thought is a condition, as proximity condition, for a factor that is with applied-thought and sustained-thought … (abridged as above) … (Nine cases.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe cha, adhipatiyā pañca, anantare nava, samanantare nava, sahajāte
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe cha adhipatiyā pañca anantare nava samanantare nava sahajāte
translated: In the section on root cause there are three, in the section on object there are six, in the section on predominance there are five, in the section on proximity there are nine, in the section on contiguity there are nine, in the section on arising together there are

original: tīṇi, aññamaññe tīṇi, nissaye tīṇi, upanissaye nava, āsevane pañca, vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: tīṇi aññamaññe tīṇi nissaye tīṇi upanissaye nava āsevane pañca vipāke tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: three, in the section on presence there are three, in the section on non-disappearance there are three, in the section on dissociation there are three, in the section on disassociation there are three, in the section on absence there are three, in the section on cessation there are three, in the section on the path there are three, in the section on non-enmity there are three, in the section on non-violence there are three, in the section on the unformed there are three.

original: Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: In the absence of root cause there are nine, in the absence of object there are nine. (Abridged.)

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi
translated: In the absence of root cause and in the absence of object there are three. (Abridged.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe cha. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe cha saṅkhitta
translated: In the absence of object and in the absence of root cause there are six. (Abridged.)

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvāraṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: yathā kusala attike pañhāvāraḥ evam
translated: (The section is to be elaborated as in the case of the three kinds of profitable.)

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Root cause

original: Savitakkasavicāraṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca savitakkasavicāro nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā (ekaṁ).
analyzed: sa vitakka sa vicāram na hetum dhammam paṭicca sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā eka
translated: A factor that is without root cause and is with applied-thought and sustained-thought is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a factor that is without root cause and is with applied-thought and sustained-thought.

original: Savitakkasavicāraṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca avitakkavicāramatto nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā (dve).
analyzed: sa vitakka sa vicāram na hetum dhammam paṭicca avitakka vicāra mattaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā dve
translated: With a condition that is without thought and without investigation, a state without thought and with investigation arises. (Two.)

original: Savitakkasavicāraṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca avitakkaavicāro nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā (tīṇi).🔽Savitakkasavicāraṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca savitakkasavicāro nahetu ca avitakkaavicāro nahetu ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā (cattāri).🔽Savitakkasavicāraṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca avitakkavicāramatto nahetu ca avitakkaavicāro nahetu ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā (pañca).
analyzed: sa vitakka sa vicāram na hetum dhammam paṭicca avitakka avicāraḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi  sa vitakka sa vicāram na hetum dhammam paṭicca sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ na hetu ca avitakka avicāraḥ na hetu ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā cattāri  sa vitakka sa vicāram na hetum dhammam paṭicca avitakka vicāra mattaḥ na hetu ca avitakka avicāraḥ na hetu ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā pañca
translated: With a condition that is without thought and without investigation, a state without thought and without investigation arises. (Three.)🔽With a condition that is without thought and without investigation, a state with thought and with investigation arises. (Four.)🔽With a condition that is without thought and without investigation, a state with thought and with investigation and a state without thought and with investigation arise. (Five.)

original: Savitakkasavicāraṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca savitakkasavicāro nahetu ca avitakkavicāramatto nahetu ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā (cha).
analyzed: sa vitakka sa vicāram na hetum dhammam paṭicca sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ na hetu ca avitakka vicāra mattaḥ na hetu ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā cha
translated: With a condition that is without thought and without investigation, a state with thought and with investigation and a state without thought and without investigation arise. (Six.)

original: Savitakkasavicāraṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca savitakkasavicāro nahetu ca avitakkavicāramatto nahetu ca avitakkaavicāro nahetu ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā (satta).
analyzed: sa vitakka sa vicāram na hetum dhammam paṭicca sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ na hetu ca avitakka vicāra mattaḥ na hetu ca avitakka avicāraḥ na hetu ca dhammāḥ uppajjanti hetu paccayā satta
translated: Dependent on a state with thinking and exploring that is without root-cause, a state with thinking and exploring that is without root-cause and a state with thinking and exploring but without investigating that is without root-cause and a state with neither thinking nor exploring that is without root-cause arise with root-cause condition …

original: Avitakkavicāramattaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca avitakkavicāramatto nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā (ekaṁ).🔽Avitakkavicāramattaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca savitakkasavicāro nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā (dve).
analyzed: avitakka vicāra mattam na hetum dhammam paṭicca avitakka vicāra mattaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā eka  avitakka vicāra mattam na hetum dhammam paṭicca sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā dve
translated: Dependent on a state with thinking and exploring but without investigating that is without root-cause, a state with thinking and exploring but without investigating that is without root-cause arises with root-cause condition …🔽Dependent on a state with thinking and exploring but without investigating that is without root-cause, a state with thinking and exploring that is without root-cause arises with root-cause condition …

original: Avitakkavicāramattaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca avitakkaavicāro nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā (tīṇi).
analyzed: avitakka vicāra mattam na hetum dhammam paṭicca avitakka avicāraḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: Dependent on a state with thinking and exploring but without investigating that is without root-cause, a state with neither thinking nor exploring that is without root-cause arises with root-cause condition …

original: Avitakkavicāramattaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca savitakkasavicāro nahetu ca avitakkaavicāro nahetu ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā (cattāri).
analyzed: avitakka vicāra mattam na hetum dhammam paṭicca sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ na hetu ca avitakka avicāraḥ na hetu ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā cattāri
translated: Dependent on a state with thinking and exploring but without investigating that is without root-cause, a state with thinking and exploring that is without root-cause and a state with neither thinking nor exploring that is without root-cause arise with root-cause condition …

original: Avitakkavicāramattaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca avitakkavicāramatto nahetu ca avitakkaavicāro nahetu ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā (pañca).🔽Avitakkaavicāraṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca avitakkaavicāro nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā (ekaṁ).
analyzed: avitakka vicāra mattam na hetum dhammam paṭicca avitakka vicāra mattaḥ na hetu ca avitakka avicāraḥ na hetu ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā pañca  avitakka avicāram na hetum dhammam paṭicca avitakka avicāraḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā eka
translated: Dependent on a state without thinking and with only exploring that is without source, a state without thinking and with only exploring that is without source and a state without thinking and without exploring that is without source arise, related by root-cause condition. (Five.)🔽Dependent on a state without thinking and without exploring that is without source, a state without thinking and without exploring that is without source arises, related by root-cause condition. (One.)

original: Avitakkaavicāraṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca savitakkasavicāro nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā (dve).🔽Avitakkaavicāraṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca avitakkavicāramatto nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā (tīṇi).
analyzed: avitakka avicāram na hetum dhammam paṭicca sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā dve  avitakka avicāram na hetum dhammam paṭicca avitakka vicāra mattaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: Dependent on a state without thinking and without exploring that is without source, a state with thinking and exploring that is without source arises, related by root-cause condition. (Two.)🔽Dependent on a state without thinking and without exploring that is without source, a state without thinking and with only exploring that is without source arises, related by root-cause condition. (Three.)

original: Avitakkaavicāraṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca savitakkasavicāro nahetu ca avitakkaavicāro nahetu ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā (cattāri).
analyzed: avitakka avicāram na hetum dhammam paṭicca sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ na hetu ca avitakka avicāraḥ na hetu ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā cattāri
translated: Dependent on a state without thinking and without exploring that is without source, a state without thinking and with only exploring that is without source and a state without thinking and without exploring that is without source arise, related by root-cause condition. (Four.)

original: Avitakkaavicāraṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca avitakkavicāramatto nahetu ca avitakkaavicāro nahetu ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā (pañca).🔽Avitakkaavicāraṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca savitakkasavicāro nahetu ca avitakkavicāramatto nahetu ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā (cha).
analyzed: avitakka avicāram na hetum dhammam paṭicca avitakka vicāra mattaḥ na hetu ca avitakka avicāraḥ na hetu ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā pañca  avitakka avicāram na hetum dhammam paṭicca sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ na hetu ca avitakka vicāra mattaḥ na hetu ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā cha
translated: Dependent on a state without thinking and exploring, without root-cause, there arises a state with thinking and exploring, without root-cause, and a state without thinking and exploring, without root-cause, as a condition being root-cause. (Five)🔽Dependent on a state without thinking and exploring, without root-cause, there arises a state with thinking and exploring, without root-cause, and a state without thinking and exploring, without root-cause, as a condition being root-cause. (Six)🔽Dependent on a state without thinking and exploring, without root-cause, there arises a state with thinking and exploring, without root-cause, and a state without thinking and exploring, without root-cause, and a state without thinking and exploring, without root-cause, as a condition being root-cause. (Seven)

original: Avitakkaavicāraṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca savitakkasavicāro nahetu ca avitakkavicāramatto nahetu ca avitakkaavicāro nahetu ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā (satta).🔽Savitakkasavicāraṁ nahetuñca avitakkaavicāraṁ nahetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca savitakkasavicāro nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā (ekaṁ).
analyzed: avitakka avicāram na hetum dhammam paṭicca sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ na hetu ca avitakka vicāra mattaḥ na hetu ca avitakka avicāraḥ na hetu ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā satta 🔽sa vitakka sa vicāram na hetuñca avitakka avicāram na hetuñca dhammam paṭicca sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā eka
translated: Dependent on a state with thinking and exploring, without root-cause, and a state without thinking and exploring, without root-cause, there arises a state with thinking and exploring, without root-cause, as a condition being root-cause. (One)

original: Savitakkasavicāraṁ nahetuñca avitakkaavicāraṁ nahetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca avitakkavicāramatto nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā (dve).🔽Savitakkasavicāraṁ nahetuñca avitakkaavicāraṁ nahetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca avitakkaavicāro nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā (tīṇi).🔽Savitakkasavicāraṁ nahetuñca avitakkaavicāraṁ nahetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca savitakkasavicāro nahetu ca avitakkaavicāro nahetu ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā (cattāri).
analyzed: sa vitakka sa vicāram na hetuñca avitakka avicāram na hetuñca dhammam paṭicca avitakka vicāra mattaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā dve  sa vitakka sa vicāram na hetum ca avitakka avicāram na hetuñca dhammam paṭicca avitakka avicāraḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi  sa vitakka sa vicāram na hetum ca avitakka avicāram na hetuñca dhammam paṭicca sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ na hetu ca avitakka avicāraḥ na hetu ca dhammāḥ uppajjanti hetu paccayā cattāri
translated: Dependent on a state with applied-thought and sustained-thought and on a state without root-cause, a state with sustained-thought only and without root-cause arises … (two triads) …🔽Dependent on a state with applied-thought and sustained-thought and on a state without root-cause, a state without applied-thought and sustained-thought and without root-cause arises … (three triads) …🔽Dependent on a state with applied-thought and sustained-thought and on a state without root-cause, a state with applied-thought and sustained-thought and a state without applied-thought and sustained-thought both without root-cause arise … (four triads) …

original: Savitakkasavicāraṁ nahetuñca avitakkaavicāraṁ nahetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca avitakkavicāramatto nahetu ca avitakkaavicāro nahetu ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā (pañca).
analyzed: sa vitakka sa vicāram na hetum ca avitakka avicāram na hetuñca dhammam paṭicca avitakka vicāra mattaḥ na hetu ca avitakka avicāraḥ na hetu ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā pañca
translated: Dependent on a state with applied-thought and sustained-thought and on a state without root-cause, a state with sustained-thought only and a state without applied-thought and sustained-thought both without root-cause arise … (five triads) …

original: Savitakkasavicāraṁ nahetuñca avitakkaavicāraṁ nahetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca savitakkasavicāro nahetu ca avitakkavicāramatto nahetu ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā (cha).🔽Savitakkasavicāraṁ nahetuñca avitakkaavicāraṁ nahetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca savitakkasavicāro
analyzed: sa vitakka sa vicāram na hetum ca avitakka avicāram na hetuñca dhammam paṭicca sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ na hetu ca avitakka vicāra mattaḥ na hetu ca dhammāḥ uppajjanti hetu paccayā cha  sa vitakka sa vicāram na hetum ca avitakka avicāram na hetum ca dhammam paṭicca sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ
translated: With applied thought and sustained thought, without cause and with applied thought and sustained thought, without cause … (six times, omitting the last two terms in each triplet).🔽With applied thought and sustained thought, without cause and with applied thought and sustained thought, without cause …

original: nahetu ca avitakkavicāramatto nahetu ca avitakkaavicāro nahetu ca dhammā uppajjanti🔽hetupaccayā (satta).🔽Avitakkavicāramattaṁ nahetuñca avitakkaavicāraṁ nahetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca savitakkasavicāro nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā (ekaṁ).
analyzed: na hetu ca avitakka vicāra mattaḥ na hetu ca avitakka avicāraḥ na hetu ca dhammā uppajjanti  hetu paccayā satta  avitakka vicāra mattam na hetuñca avitakka avicāram na hetuñca dhammam paṭicca sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā eka
translated: with applied thought and sustained thought, without cause and with sustained thought only, without cause and without applied thought and sustained thought, without cause … (seven times).🔽With sustained thought only, without cause and with sustained thought only, without cause … (omitting the last two terms in each triplet).

original: Avitakkavicāramattaṁ nahetuñca avitakkaavicāraṁ nahetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca avitakkavicāramatto nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā (dve).

translated: With sustained thought only, without cause and with sustained thought only, without cause … (omitting the last two terms in each triplet).

original: Avitakkavicāramattaṁ nahetuñca avitakkaavicāraṁ nahetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca avitakkaavicāro nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā (tīṇi).

translated: With a factor having thinking and exploring only that is not a root-cause as condition… (three sets of three).

translated: With a factor having thinking and exploring only that is not a root-cause as condition… (four sets of four).🔽With a factor having thinking and exploring only that is not a root-cause as condition… (five sets of five).

original: Avitakkavicāramatto nahetu ca avitakkaavicāro nahetu ca dhammā avitakkaavicārassa
analyzed: a vitakka vicāra mattaḥ na hetu ca avitakka avicāraḥ na hetu ca dhammā avitakka avicārassa
translated: The non-causally arisen states that are without thought and with investigation and the non-causally arisen states that are without thought and without investigation are a condition, as object condition, for the non-causally arisen states that are without thought and without investigation.

original: nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. Avitakkavicāramatto nahetu ca avitakkaavicāro🔽nahetu ca dhammā savitakkasavicārassa nahetussa ca avitakkavicāramattassa nahetussa
analyzed: na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ avitakka vicāra mattaḥ na hetu ca avitakka avicāro  na hetu ca dhammā sa vitakka sa vicārassa na hetussa ca avitakka vicāra mattassa na hetussa
translated: A state that is not a cause is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is not a cause. A state that is not a cause and is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is not a cause and is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought.🔽A state that is not a cause and is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is not a cause and is free from applied thought but accompanied by sustained thought.🔽

original: ca dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … cattāri.🔽Savitakkasavicāro nahetu ca avitakkavicāramatto nahetu ca dhammā savitakkasavicārassa
analyzed: ca dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ cattāri  sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ na hetu ca avitakka vicāra mattaḥ na hetu ca dhammā sa vitakka sa vicārassa
translated: A state that is not a cause is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is not a cause. A state that is not a cause and is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is not a cause and is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought, and for a state that is not a cause and is accompanied by applied thought only. … Four.

original: nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. Savitakkasavicāro nahetu ca avitakkavicāramatto🔽nahetu ca dhammā avitakkavicāramattassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.🔽Savitakkasavicāro nahetu ca avitakkavicāramatto nahetu ca dhammā avitakkaavicārassa

translated: A state that is not a cause and is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is not a cause and is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought. A state that is not a cause and is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is not a cause and is accompanied by applied thought only.

original: nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. Savitakkasavicāro nahetu ca avitakkavicāramatto
analyzed: na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ na hetu ca avitakka vicāra mattaḥ
translated: A state that is not a cause and is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is not a cause and is without applied thought and without sustained thought. A state that is not a cause and is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is not a cause and is accompanied by applied thought only, and for a state that is not a cause and is without applied thought and without sustained thought.🔽A state that is not a cause and is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is not a cause and is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought. A state that is not a cause and is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is not a cause and is accompanied by applied thought only.

original: nahetu ca dhammā savitakkasavicārassa nahetussa ca avitakkavicāramattassa nahetussa
analyzed: na hetu ca dhammā sa vitakka sa vicārassa na hetussa ca avitakka vicāra mattassa na hetussa
translated: and neither-unwholesome-nor-wholesome thoughts are related to thoughts accompanied by applied and sustained thought that are neither-unwholesome-nor-wholesome and to thoughts without applied thought, with sustained thought only that are neither-unwholesome-nor-wholesome and to thoughts without applied thought and without sustained thought that are neither-unwholesome-nor-wholesome and to thoughts accompanied by joy that are neither-unwholesome-nor-wholesome and to thoughts accompanied by equanimity that are neither-unwholesome-nor-wholesome.

original: ca dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … cattāri.🔽Adhipati
analyzed: ca dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ cattāri  adhipati
translated: and states that are not a root condition for states that are not a root condition and that are accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought, and for states that are not a root condition and that are without applied thought but with sustained thought only, are a condition, as object condition, for states that are not a root condition and that are accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought, and for states that are not a root condition and that are without applied thought but with sustained thought only, and for states that are not a root condition and that are without applied thought and sustained thought. There are four.

original: Savitakkasavicāro nahetu dhammo savitakkasavicārassa nahetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo … satta.
analyzed: sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ na hetu dhammo sa vitakka sa vicārassa na hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ satta
translated: Dominant condition means: A state that is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought and that is not a root condition is a dominant condition for a state that is not a root condition and that is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought. … There are seven.

original: Avitakkavicāramatto nahetu dhammo avitakkavicāramattassa nahetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo … pañca.
analyzed: a vitakka vicāra mattaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ a vitakka vicāra mattassa na hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ pañca
translated: A state that is without applied thought but with sustained thought only and that is not a root condition is a dominant condition for a state that is not a root condition and that is without applied thought but with sustained thought only. … There are five.

original: Avitakkaavicāro nahetu dhammo avitakkaavicārassa nahetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo … pañca.
analyzed: avitakka avicāraḥ na hetu dhammaḥ avitakka avicārassa na hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ pañca
translated: A state that is without applied thought and sustained thought and that is not a root condition is a dominant condition for a state that is not a root condition and that is without applied thought and sustained thought. … There are five.

original: Avitakkavicāramatto nahetu ca avitakkaavicāro nahetu ca dhammā savitakkasavicārassa nahetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: avitakka vicāra mattaḥ na hetu ca avitakka avicāraḥ na hetu ca dhammā sa vitakka sa vicārassa na hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A state that is without applied thought but with sustained thought only and that is not a root condition, and a state that is without applied thought and sustained thought and that is not a root condition, are a dominant condition for a state that is not a root condition and that is accompanied by applied thought and sustained thought. … There are three.

original: Savitakkasavicāro nahetu ca avitakkavicāramatto nahetu ca dhammā savitakkasavicārassa nahetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ na hetu ca avitakka vicāra mattaḥ na hetu ca dhammā sa vitakka sa vicārassa na hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: Factors that are with-conveying-and-re-pondering and without cause are related to factors that are with-conveying-and-re-pondering and without cause as a dominant condition in three ways.

original: Anantarādi
analyzed: anantara ādi
translated: Immediate and so on

original: Savitakkasavicāro nahetu dhammo savitakkasavicārassa nahetussa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo …pe… samanantarapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ na hetu dhammo sa vitakka sa vicārassa na hetussa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ pe samanantara paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A factor that is with-conveying-and-re-pondering and without cause is related to a factor that is with-conveying-and-re-pondering and without cause as an immediately preceding condition … as a directly antecedent condition.

original: Savitakkasavicāro nahetu dhammo savitakkasavicārassa nahetussa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Ārammaṇe ekavīsa, adhipatiyā tevīsa, anantare pañcavīsa, samanantare pañcavīsa, sahajāte
analyzed: sa vitakka sa vicāraḥ na hetu dhammo sa vitakka sa vicārassa na hetussa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhitta  ārammaṇe ekavīsa adhipatiyā tevīsa anantare pañcavīsa samanantare pañcavīsa sahajāte
translated: A factor that is with-conveying-and-re-pondering and without cause is related to a factor that is with-conveying-and-re-pondering and without cause as a support condition. analyzed: tisa aññamaññe aṭṭhavīsa nissaye tisa upanissaye pañcavīsa purejāte pañca
translated: thirty; in the mutuality, twenty-eight; in the support, thirty; in the object-predominant, twenty-five; in the prenascence, five;

original: pacchājāte pañca, āsevane ekavīsa, kamme ekādasa, vipāke ekavīsa, āhāre ekādasa,
analyzed: pacchājāte pañca āsevane ekavīsa kamme ekādasa vipāke ekavīsa āhāre ekādasa
translated: in the postnascence, five; in the repetition, twenty-one; in the kamma, eleven; in the result, twenty-one; in the nutriment, eleven;

original: indriye ekādasa, jhāne ekavīsa, magge soḷasa, sampayutte ekādasa, vippayutte nava
analyzed: indriye ekādasa jhāne ekavīsa magge soḷasa sampayutte ekādasa vippayutte nava
translated: in terms of faculties, eleven; in terms of jhānas, twenty-one; in terms of paths, sixteen; in terms of associations, eleven; in terms of dissociations, nine.

original: …pe… avigate tiṁsa. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: pe avigate tisa saṅkhitta
translated: … in terms of the unobscured-neutral, thirty. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetuyā pañcatiṁsa, naārammaṇe pañcatiṁsa, naadhipatiyā pañcatiṁsa. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Ārammaṇapaccayā nahetuyā ekavīsa. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā pañcatisa na ārammaṇe pañcatisa na adhipatiyā pañcatisa  ārammaṇa paccayā na hetuyā ekavīsa
translated: In terms of the not-roots, thirty-five; in terms of the not-objects, thirty-five; in terms of the not-predominances, thirty-five. (Abbreviated.)🔽In terms of object condition, in terms of the not-roots, twenty-one. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe ekavīsa. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe ekavīsa saṅkhitta
translated: In terms of the not-roots, in terms of object condition, twenty-one. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvāraṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: yathā kusala attike pañhāvāraḥ evam
translated: … (The section on the questions is to be expanded as for the wholesome triad.)

original: 4.1.7. Pītittika, Hetuduka
analyzed: pītittika hetuduka
translated: … with joy, with cause,

original: Paccayacatukka🔽Pītisahagataṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca pītisahagato hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Sukhasahagataṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sukhasahagato hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.

translated: The fourfold condition🔽A factor associated with joy that is a cause has as its condition a factor associated with joy that is a cause. … There are three.🔽A factor associated with pleasure that is a cause has as its condition a factor associated with pleasure that is a cause. … There are three.

original: Upekkhāsahagataṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca upekkhāsahagato hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ.
analyzed: upekkhā sahagatam hetum dhammam paṭicca upekkhā sahagataḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā eka
translated: A factor associated with equanimity that is a cause has as its condition a factor associated with equanimity that is a cause. … There is one.

original: Pītisahagataṁ hetuñca sukhasahagataṁ hetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca pītisahagato hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā dasa, ārammaṇe dasa …pe… avigate dasa. original: Pītisahagato hetu ca sukhasahagato hetu ca dhammā pītisahagatassa hetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.🔽Pītisahagato hetu dhammo pītisahagatassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.🔽Pītisahagato hetu dhammo sukhasahagatassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.🔽Pītisahagato hetu dhammo upekkhāsahagatassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: pīti sahagataḥ hetu ca sukha sahagataḥ hetu ca dhammā pīti sahagatassa hetussa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi  pīti sahagataḥ hetu dhammaḥ pīti sahagatassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ  pīti sahagataḥ hetu dhammaḥ sukha sahagatassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ  pīti sahagataḥ hetu dhammaḥ upekkhā sahagatassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo
translated: Factors that are accompanied by happiness and are a cause are related to a factor that is accompanied by happiness and is a cause as a cause condition. … three.🔽A factor that is accompanied by happiness and is a cause is related to a factor that is accompanied by happiness and is a cause as object condition.🔽A factor that is accompanied by happiness and is a cause is related to a factor that is accompanied by bliss and is a cause as object condition.🔽A factor that is accompanied by happiness and is a cause is related to a factor that is accompanied by equanimity and is a cause as object condition.

original: Pītisahagato hetu dhammo pītisahagatassa hetussa ca sukhasahagatassa hetussa ca dhammassa
analyzed: pīti sahagataḥ hetu dhammaḥ pīti sahagatassa hetussa ca sukha sahagatassa hetussa ca dhammassa
translated: A factor that is accompanied by happiness and is a cause is related to a factor that is accompanied by happiness and is a cause and to a factor that is accompanied by bliss and is a cause as object condition.

original: ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … cattāri.🔽Sukhasahagato hetu dhammo sukhasahagatassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ cattāri  sukha sahagataḥ hetu dhammaḥ sukha sahagatassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: … four.🔽A factor that is accompanied by bliss and is a cause is related to a factor that is accompanied by bliss and is a cause as object condition.

original: Sukhasahagato hetu dhammo pītisahagatassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: sukha sahagataḥ hetu dhammaḥ pīti sahagatassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A factor that is accompanied by bliss and is a cause is related to a factor that is accompanied by happiness and is a cause as object condition.

original: Sukhasahagato hetu dhammo upekkhāsahagatassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena🔽paccayo. Sukhasahagato hetu dhammo pītisahagatassa hetussa ca sukhasahagatassa hetussa
analyzed: sukha sahagataḥ hetu dhammaḥ upekkhā sahagatassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena  paccayaḥ sukha sahagataḥ hetu dhammaḥ pīti sahagatassa hetussa ca sukha sahagatassa hetussa
translated: A cause dhamma associated with pleasure is related to a cause dhamma associated with equanimity as object condition.

original: ca dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … cattāri.
analyzed: ca dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ cattāri
translated: A cause dhamma associated with pleasure is related to a cause dhamma associated with happiness and to a cause dhamma associated with pleasure as object condition. … four.

original: Upekkhāsahagato hetu dhammo upekkhāsahagatassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena🔽paccayo. Upekkhāsahagato hetu dhammo pītisahagatassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: upekkhā sahagataḥ hetu dhammaḥ upekkhā sahagatassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena  paccayaḥ upekkhā sahagataḥ hetu dhammaḥ pīti sahagatassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: A cause dhamma associated with equanimity is related to a cause dhamma associated with equanimity as object condition.🔽A cause dhamma associated with equanimity is related to a cause dhamma associated with happiness as object condition.

original: paccayo. Upekkhāsahagato hetu dhammo sukhasahagatassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena🔽paccayo. Upekkhāsahagato hetu dhammo pītisahagatassa hetussa ca sukhasahagatassa
analyzed: paccayaḥ upekkhā sahagataḥ hetu dhammaḥ sukha sahagatassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena  paccayaḥ upekkhā sahagataḥ hetu dhammaḥ pīti sahagatassa hetussa ca sukha sahagatassa
translated: A cause dhamma associated with equanimity is related to a cause dhamma associated with pleasure as object condition.

original: hetussa ca dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … cattāri.
analyzed: hetussa ca dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ cattāri
translated: A cause dhamma associated with equanimity is related to a cause dhamma associated with happiness and to a cause dhamma associated with pleasure as object condition. … four.

original: Pītisahagato hetu ca sukhasahagato hetu ca dhammā pītisahagatassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … cattāri.
analyzed: pīti sahagataḥ hetu ca sukha sahagataḥ hetu ca dhammā pīti sahagatassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ cattāri
translated: Factors that are associated with happiness and are a cause are a condition, as object condition, for a factor that is associated with happiness and is a cause. … four.

original: Pītisahagato hetu dhammo pītisahagatassa hetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo.🔽Hetuyā dasa, ārammaṇe soḷasa, adhipatiyā soḷasa, anantare soḷasa, samanantare soḷasa,🔽sahajāte dasa, aññamaññe dasa, nissaye dasa, upanissaye soḷasa …pe… vipāke dasa …pe…
analyzed: pīti sahagataḥ hetu dhammaḥ pīti sahagatassa hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ  hetuyā dasa ārammaṇe soḷasa adhipatiyā soḷasa anantare soḷasa samanantare soḷasa  sahajāte dasa aññamaññe dasa nissaye dasa upanissaye soḷasa pe vipāke dasa pe
translated: A factor that is associated with happiness and is a cause is a condition, as dominant condition, for a factor that is associated with happiness and is a cause.🔽As to cause: ten. As to object: sixteen. As to predominance: sixteen. As to proximity: sixteen.

original: avigate dasa. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: a vigate dasa
translated: As to contiguity: sixteen. As to presence: ten. As to absence: ten. As to disappearance: ten. As to arising: ten. As to falling away: ten. As to maintenance: ten. As to support: ten. As to non-disappearance: ten. (In brief.)

original: Nahetuyā soḷasa, naārammaṇe soḷasa. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe dasa. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā soḷasa na ārammaṇe soḷasa saṅkhitta  hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe dasa
translated: As to not being a cause: sixteen. As to not being an object: sixteen. (In brief.)🔽As to cause and not being an object: ten. (In brief.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe soḷasa. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe soḷasa
translated: As to not being a cause and an object: sixteen. (In brief.)

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvāraṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: yathā kusala attike pañhāvāraḥ evam
translated: (The section on the triads should be expanded as for the wholesome triad.)

original: Hetu-ārammaṇa
analyzed: hetu ārammaṇa
translated: Cause and object

original: Pītisahagataṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca pītisahagato nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: pīti sahagatam na hetum dhammam paṭicca pīti sahagataḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A factor that is associated with happiness and is not a cause is a condition, as a condition being a cause condition, for a factor that is associated with happiness and is not a cause.

original: Pītisahagataṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sukhasahagato nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: pīti sahagatam na hetum dhammam paṭicca sukha sahagataḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a condition that is connected with happiness and is without root-cause there arises a state of consciousness that is connected with happiness and is without root-cause.

analyzed: paccayaḥ pīti sahagataḥ na hetu dhammaḥ pīti sahagatassa na hetussa ca sukha sahagatassa  na hetussa ca dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ  sukha sahagataḥ na hetu dhammaḥ sukha sahagatassa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena  paccayaḥ sukha sahagataḥ na hetu dhammaḥ pīti sahagatassa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: A state that is accompanied by happiness and is without root-cause is related to a state that is accompanied by bliss and is without root-cause as object condition.🔽A state that is accompanied by bliss and is without root-cause is related to a state that is accompanied by bliss and is without root-cause as object condition.🔽A state that is accompanied by bliss and is without root-cause is related to a state that is accompanied by happiness and is without root-cause as object condition.

original: paccayo. Sukhasahagato nahetu dhammo upekkhāsahagatassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena🔽paccayo. Sukhasahagato nahetu dhammo pītisahagatassa nahetussa ca sukhasahagatassa
analyzed: paccayaḥ sukha sahagataḥ na hetu dhammaḥ upekkhā sahagatassa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena  paccayaḥ sukha sahagataḥ na hetu dhammaḥ pīti sahagatassa na hetussa ca sukha sahagatassa
translated: A state that is accompanied by bliss and is without root-cause is related to a state that is accompanied by equanimity and is without root-cause as object condition.

original: nahetussa ca dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: na hetussa ca dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A state that is accompanied by bliss and is without root-cause is related to a state that is accompanied by happiness and is without root-cause and a state that is accompanied by bliss and is without root-cause as object condition.

original: Upekkhāsahagato nahetu dhammo upekkhāsahagatassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: upekkhā sahagataḥ na hetu dhammaḥ upekkhā sahagatassa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: A state that is accompanied by equanimity and is without root-cause is related to a state that is accompanied by equanimity and is without root-cause as object condition.

original: paccayo. Upekkhāsahagato nahetu dhammo pītisahagatassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena🔽paccayo. Upekkhāsahagato nahetu dhammo sukhasahagatassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: paccayaḥ upekkhā sahagataḥ na hetu dhammaḥ pīti sahagatassa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena  paccayaḥ upekkhā sahagataḥ na hetu dhammaḥ sukha sahagatassa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: A state that is accompanied by equanimity and is without root-cause is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is accompanied by joy and is without root-cause.🔽A state that is accompanied by equanimity and is without root-cause is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is accompanied by pleasure and is without root-cause.

original: paccayo. Upekkhāsahagato nahetu dhammo pītisahagatassa nahetussa ca sukhasahagatassa🔽nahetussa ca dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.🔽Pītisahagato nahetu ca sukhasahagato nahetu ca dhammā pītisahagatassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … cattāri.🔽Pītisahagato nahetu dhammo pītisahagatassa nahetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo … cattāri.
analyzed: paccayaḥ upekkhā sahagataḥ na hetu dhammaḥ pīti sahagatassa na hetussa ca sukha sahagatassa  na hetussa ca dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ  pīti sahagataḥ na hetu ca sukha sahagataḥ na hetu ca dhammā pīti sahagatassa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ cattāri  pīti sahagataḥ na hetu dhammaḥ pīti sahagatassa na hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ cattāri
translated: A state that is accompanied by equanimity and is without root-cause is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is accompanied by joy and is without root-cause and for a state that is accompanied by pleasure and is without root-cause.🔽A state that is accompanied by joy and is without root-cause and a state that is accompanied by pleasure and is without root-cause are a condition, as object condition, for a state that is accompanied by joy and is without root-cause … four.🔽A state that is accompanied by joy and is without root-cause is a condition, as predominance condition, for a state that is accompanied by joy and is without root-cause … four.

original: Sukhasahagato nahetu dhammo sukhasahagatassa nahetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo … cattāri.
analyzed: sukha sahagataḥ na hetu dhammaḥ sukha sahagatassa na hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ cattāri
translated: A state that is accompanied by pleasure and is without root-cause is a condition, as predominance condition, for a state that is accompanied by pleasure and is without root-cause … four.

original: Upekkhāsahagato nahetu dhammo upekkhāsahagatassa nahetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo … cattāri.🔽Pītisahagato nahetu ca sukhasahagato nahetu ca dhammā pītisahagatassa nahetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo … cattāri.🔽Pītisahagato nahetu dhammo pītisahagatassa nahetussa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo …pe… upanissayapaccayena paccayo … cattāri.
analyzed: upekkhā sahagataḥ na hetu dhammaḥ upekkhā sahagatassa na hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ cattāri  pīti sahagataḥ na hetu ca sukha sahagataḥ na hetu ca dhammā pīti sahagatassa na hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ cattāri  pīti sahagataḥ na hetu dhammaḥ pīti sahagatassa na hetussa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ pe upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ cattāri
translated: A state that is neither a root nor associated with a root and that is accompanied by equanimity is a condition, as a dominant condition, for a state that is neither a root nor associated with a root and that is accompanied by equanimity. … four.🔽A state that is neither a root nor associated with a root and that is accompanied by happiness is a condition, as a dominant condition, for a state that is neither a root nor associated with a root and that is accompanied by happiness. … four.🔽A state that is neither a root nor associated with a root and that is accompanied by happiness is a condition, as an immediately preceding condition, for a state that is neither a root nor associated with a root and that is accompanied by happiness. … four.

original: Sukhasahagato nahetu dhammo sukhasahagatassa nahetussa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo … cattāri.
analyzed: sukha sahagataḥ na hetu dhammaḥ sukha sahagatassa na hetussa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ cattāri
translated: A state that is neither a root nor associated with a root and that is accompanied by pleasure is a condition, as a support condition, for a state that is neither a root nor associated with a root and that is accompanied by pleasure. … four.

original: Upekkhāsahagato nahetu dhammo upekkhāsahagatassa nahetussa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo … cattāri.
analyzed: upekkhā sahagataḥ na hetu dhammaḥ upekkhā sahagatassa na hetussa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ cattāri
translated: A state that is neither a root nor associated with a root and that is accompanied by equanimity is a condition, as a support condition, for a state that is neither a root nor associated with a root and that is accompanied by equanimity. … four.

original: Pītisahagato nahetu ca sukhasahagato nahetu ca dhammā pītisahagatassa nahetussa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo … cattāri. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: pīti sahagataḥ na hetu ca sukha sahagataḥ na hetu ca dhammā pīti sahagatassa na hetussa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ cattāri
translated: Factors that are associated with happiness and are without root-cause and factors that are associated with pleasure and are without root-cause are a condition, as a decisive support condition, for a factor that is associated with happiness and is without root-cause. … (Abbreviated.)

original: Ārammaṇe soḷasa, adhipatiyā soḷasa, anantare samanantare soḷasa, sahajāte dasa, aññamaññe
analyzed: ārammaṇe soḷasa adhipatiyā soḷasa anantare samanantare soḷasa sahajāte dasa aññamaññe
translated: In the section on object, there are sixteen. In the section on predominance, there are sixteen. In the sections on proximity and contiguity, there are sixteen. In the section on conascence, there are ten. In the section on mutuality,

original: dasa, nissaye dasa, upanissaye soḷasa, āsevane dasa, kamme soḷasa, āhāre dasa …pe…
analyzed: dasa nissaye dasa upanissaye soḷasa āsevane dasa kamme soḷasa āhāre dasa pe
translated: there are ten. In the section on support, there are ten. In the section on nutriment, there are ten. …

original: avigate dasa. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: a vigate dasa
translated: In the section on non-hindrance, there are ten. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetuyā soḷasa, naārammaṇe soḷasa, naadhipatiyā soḷasa. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Ārammaṇapaccayā nahetuyā soḷasa. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā soḷasa na ārammaṇe soḷasa na adhipatiyā soḷasa  ārammaṇa paccayā na hetuyā soḷasa
translated: In the section on non-cause, there are sixteen. In the section on non-object, there are sixteen. In the section on non-predominance, there are sixteen. (Abbreviated.)🔽In the section on object condition, there are sixteen in the section on non-cause. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe soḷasa. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe soḷasa
translated: In the section on non-cause condition, there are sixteen in the section on object. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvāraṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)🔽4.1.8. Dassanenapahātabbattika, Hetuduka
analyzed: yathā kusala attike pañhāvāraḥ evam  dassanena apahātabba ttika hetu duka
translated: (The section is to be expanded in the same way as the Triad on the Wholesome.)🔽The Triad on What is to be Eliminated by Seeing, with Root-Cause

original: Paccayacatukka
analyzed: paccaya catukka
translated: The Four Categories of Conditions

original: Dassanena pahātabbaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca dassanena pahātabbo hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: dassanena pahātabbam hetum dhammam paṭicca dassanena pahātabbaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a cause that is to be given up by seeing comes a state that is to be given up by seeing by way of cause condition.

original: Bhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca bhāvanāya pahātabbo hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: bhāvanāya pahātabbam hetum dhammam paṭicca bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a cause that is to be given up by development comes a state that is to be given up by development by way of cause condition.

original: Nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbam hetum dhammam paṭicca na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a cause that is neither to be given up by seeing nor by development comes a state that is neither to be given up by seeing nor by development by way of cause condition. (Condensed.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi (sabbattha tīṇi), vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi sabbattha tīṇi vipāke ekam pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With a cause there are three. With an effect there is one. … With an unobscured state there are three.

original: Naadhipatiyā tīṇi, napurejāte tīṇi …pe… navippayutte tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na adhipatiyā tīṇi na purejāte tīṇi pe na vippayutte tīṇi
translated: With a non-predominant state there are three. With a non-prenascence state there are three. … With a non-support state there are three. (Condensed.)

original: (Sahajātavārampi …pe… sampayuttavārampi vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāram pi pe sampayutta vāram pi
translated: (The section on the origination of the simultaneous factor should be expanded in detail.)

original: Dassanena pahātabbo hetu dhammo dassanena pahātabbassa hetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: dassanena pahātabbaḥ hetu dhammaḥ dassanena pahātabbassa hetussa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A cause that is to be given up by seeing is related to a cause that is to be given up by seeing by way of cause condition. … There are three.

original: Dassanena pahātabbo hetu dhammo dassanena pahātabbassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: dassanena pahātabbaḥ hetu dhammaḥ dassanena pahātabbassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhitta
translated: A state that is to be given up by seeing is related to a cause that is to be given up by seeing as object condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe aṭṭha, adhipatiyā cha, anantare pañca, samanantare pañca, sahajāte🔽tīṇi, aññamaññe tīṇi, nissaye tīṇi, upanissaye aṭṭha, āsevane tīṇi, vipāke ekaṁ,
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe aṭṭha adhipatiyā cha anantare pañca samanantare pañca sahajāte  tīṇi aññamaññe tīṇi nissaye tīṇi upanissaye aṭṭha āsevane tīṇi vipāke eka
translated: With respect to cause there are three, with respect to object there are eight, with respect to predominance there are six, with respect to proximity there are five, with respect to contiguity there are five, with respect to arising together there are🔽three, with respect to presence there are three, with respect to non-disappearance there are three, with respect to result there is one,

original: indriye ekaṁ, magge ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: indriye eka magge ekam pe avigate tīṇi
translated: with respect to nutriment there is one, with respect to faculty there is one, with respect to path there is one, … with respect to non-distortion there are three. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetuyā aṭṭha, naārammaṇe aṭṭha. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā aṭṭha na ārammaṇe aṭṭha saṅkhitta
translated: With respect to non-cause there are eight, with respect to non-object there are eight. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi
translated: With respect to cause and non-object there are three. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe aṭṭha. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe aṭṭha saṅkhitta
translated: With respect to non-cause and object there are eight. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvāraṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: yathā kusala attike pañhāvāraḥ evam
translated: (The section on the questions should be expanded as for the wholesome triad.)

original: Hetu-ārammaṇa
analyzed: hetu ārammaṇa
translated: Cause and object

original: Dassanena pahātabbaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca dassanena pahātabbo nahetu dhammo uppajjati
analyzed: dassanena pahātabbam na hetum dhammam paṭicca dassanena pahātabbaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati
translated: A state that is to be given up by seeing and that is not a cause is related to a state that is to be given up by seeing and that is not a cause as object condition …

original: hetupaccayā. Dassanena pahātabbaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nevadassanena nabhāvanāya🔽pahātabbo nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Dassanena pahātabbaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ🔽paṭicca dassanena pahātabbo nahetu ca nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo nahetu🔽ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Bhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca bhāvanāya pahātabbo nahetu dhammo uppajjati🔽hetupaccayā. Bhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nevadassanena nabhāvanāya
analyzed: hetu paccayā dassanena pahātabbam na hetum dhammam paṭicca na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya  pahātabbaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā dassanena pahātabbam na hetum dhamma  paṭicca dassanena pahātabbaḥ na hetu ca na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ na hetu  ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā tīṇi  bhāvanāya pahātabbam na hetum dhammam paṭicca bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati  hetu paccayā bhāvanāya pahātabbam na hetum dhammam paṭicca na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya
translated: With non-causes as condition. A non-cause that is not to be given up through vision (of the First Path) arises with non-cause that is not to be given up through vision (of the First Path) as condition. A non-cause that is not to be given up through vision (of the First Path) arises with a non-cause that is to be given up through vision (of the First Path) as condition. A non-cause that is not to be given up through vision (of the First Path) arises with a non-cause that is to be given up through vision (of the First Path) and a non-cause that is not to be given up through vision (of the First Path) as condition. … (Three times.)

original: pahātabbo nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Bhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ🔽paṭicca bhāvanāya pahātabbo nahetu ca nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo nahetu🔽ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: pahātabbaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā bhāvanāya pahātabbam na hetum dhamma 🔽paṭicca bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ na hetu ca na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ na hetu 🔽ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With non-causes as condition. A non-cause that is to be given up through development arises with a non-cause that is to be given up through development as condition. A non-cause that is to be given up through development arises with a non-cause that is not to be given up through vision (of the First Path) as condition. A non-cause that is to be given up through development arises with a non-cause that is to be given up through development and a non-cause that is not to be given up through vision (of the First Path) as condition. … (Three times.)

original: Nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Dassanena pahātabbaṁ nahetuñca nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ nahetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbam na hetum dhammam paṭicca na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā  dassanena pahātabbam na hetuñca na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbam na hetuñca dhammam paṭicca na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With the condition of a state that is neither to be abandoned by seeing nor by cultivation, a state that is neither to be abandoned by seeing nor by cultivation arises that is without cause.🔽With the condition of a state that is to be abandoned by seeing and a state that is neither to be abandoned by seeing nor by cultivation, a state that is neither to be abandoned by seeing nor by cultivation arises that is without cause.

original: Bhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ nahetuñca nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ nahetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: bhāvanāya pahātabbam na hetuñca na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbam na hetuñca dhammam paṭicca na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With the condition of a state that is to be abandoned by cultivation and a state that is neither to be abandoned by seeing nor by cultivation, a state that is neither to be abandoned by seeing nor by cultivation arises that is without cause.

original: Dassanena pahātabbaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca dassanena pahātabbo nahetu dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā.
analyzed: dassanena pahātabbam na hetum dhammam paṭicca dassanena pahātabbaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā
translated: With the condition of a state that is to be abandoned by seeing, a state that is to be abandoned by seeing arises that is without cause.

original: Bhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca bhāvanāya pahātabbo nahetu dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā.
analyzed: bhāvanāya pahātabbam na hetum dhammam paṭicca bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā
translated: With the condition of a state that is to be abandoned by cultivation, a state that is to be abandoned by cultivation arises that is without cause.

original: Nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo nahetu dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbam na hetum dhammam paṭicca na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: With the non-arising of what is to be abandoned by seeing and by keeping in being, a state that is not a root condition arises that is not to be abandoned by seeing and by keeping in being. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe tīṇi, adhipatiyā nava …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā nava pe vipāke ekam pe avigate nava saṅkhitta
translated: In the cause there are nine. In the object there are three. In the predominance there are nine. … In the fruit there is one. … In the unincluded there are nine. (In brief.)

original: Nahetu-naārammaṇa🔽Nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo nahetu dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā.🔽Dassanena pahātabbaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo nahetu dhammo uppajjati naārammaṇapaccayā.

original: Bhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbo nahetu dhammo uppajjati naārammaṇapaccayā.

translated: A state that is not to be given up through seeing or through development is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is not to be given up through seeing or through development. … There are three. (In brief.)

original: avigate terasa. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: a vigate
translated: In the case of nongreed, thirteen. (In brief.)

original: Nahetuyā cuddasa, naārammaṇe cuddasa. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā cuddasa na ārammaṇe cuddasa saṅkhitta
translated: In the case of non-cause, fourteen; in the case of non-object, fourteen. (In brief.)

original: Ārammaṇapaccayā nahetuyā aṭṭha. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: ārammaṇa paccayā na hetuyā aṭṭha saṅkhitta

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe aṭṭha. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe aṭṭha saṅkhitta
translated: In the case of non-cause condition, in the case of object, eight. (In brief.)

analyzed: yathā kusala attike pañhāvāraḥ evam

analyzed: sahajāta vāram pi pe sampayutta vāram pi paṭicca vāra sadisam
translated: (The section on the origination of the simultaneous condition should be expanded in detail as in the Dependent Origination.)

original: Ārammaṇa🔽Dassanena pahātabbahetuko nahetu dhammo dassanena pahātabbahetukassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … dve.🔽Bhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko nahetu dhammo bhāvanāya pahātabbahetukassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: ārammaṇa  dassanena pahātabba hetukaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ dassanena pahātabba hetukassa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ dve  bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukassa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: Object🔽A state that is a cause to be abandoned by insight and is without cause is a condition, by way of object condition, for a state that is a cause to be abandoned by insight and is without cause … two.🔽A state that is a cause to be abandoned by development and is without cause is a condition, by way of object condition, for a state that is a cause to be abandoned by development and is without cause … three.

original: Nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbahetuko nahetu dhammo nevadassanena nabhāvanāya pahātabbahetukassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ na iva dassanena na bhāvanāya pahātabba hetukassa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi saṅkhitta
translated: A state that is a cause to be abandoned neither by insight nor by development and is without cause is a condition, by way of object condition, for a state that is a cause to be abandoned neither by insight nor by development and is without cause … three. (Abbreviated.)

original: Ārammaṇe aṭṭha, adhipatiyā dasa …pe… upanissaye aṭṭha …pe… avigate terasa. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: ārammaṇe aṭṭha adhipatiyā dasa pe upanissaye aṭṭha pe avigate terasa saṅkhitta
translated: As object, ten … (In detail as in the Tripiṭaka section, §1.)

original: Nahetuyā cuddasa, naārammaṇe cuddasa. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Ārammaṇapaccayā nahetuyā aṭṭha. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā cuddasa na ārammaṇe cuddasa saṅkhitta  ārammaṇa paccayā na hetuyā aṭṭha saṅkhitta
translated: As not object, fourteen … (In detail as in the Tripiṭaka section, §1.)🔽As object condition, eight … (In detail as in the Tripiṭaka section, §1.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe aṭṭha. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe aṭṭha saṅkhitta
translated: As not object condition, eight … (In detail as in the Tripiṭaka section, §1.)

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvāraṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: yathā kusala attike pañhāvāraḥ evam
translated: … As the section on questions in the case of the wholesome triad, this should be expanded in detail.

original: 4.1.10. Ācayagāmittika, Hetuduka
analyzed: ācaya gāmittika
translated: … With Increase, etc. as Source

original: Hetu🔽Ācayagāmiṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ācayagāmī hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: hetu  ācaya gāmim hetum dhammam paṭicca ācaya gāmī hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: Source🔽A source with increase as source …🔽A source with decrease as source …

original: Apacayagāmiṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca apacayagāmī hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Nevācayagāmināpacayagāmiṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nevācayagāmināpacayagāmī hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)

translated: A source neither with increase nor with decrease as source …

analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi sabbattha tīṇi
translated: As source, three … As object, three … As predominance, three … (In each triad, three.)

original: Hetupaccayā naadhipatiyā tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na adhipatiyā tīṇi
translated: With respect to the non-dominant condition there are three. With respect to the non-associated cause there are two. With respect to the non-retribution there are three. With respect to the non-related there are three. (Abbreviated.)🔽With respect to the non-dominant condition there are three. (Abbreviated.)

original: Naadhipatipaccayā hetuyā tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na adhipati paccayā hetuyā tīṇi
translated: With respect to the non-associated cause there are three. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Sahajātavārampi …pe… sampayuttavārampi paṭiccavārasadisaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāram pi pe sampayutta vāram pi paṭicca vāra sadisam
translated: (The section on the origination through conditionality should be expanded in the same way as in the section on the origination through association.)

original: Hetu-ārammaṇādi
analyzed: hetu ārammaṇa ādi
translated: Cause and object, etc.

original: Ācayagāmī hetu dhammo ācayagāmissa hetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.🔽Apacayagāmī hetu dhammo apacayagāmissa hetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: ācaya gāmī hetu dhammaḥ ācaya gāmissa hetussa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ  apacaya gāmī hetu dhammaḥ apacaya gāmissa hetussa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A cause that leads to increase is a condition, by way of cause condition, for a state that leads to increase.🔽A cause that leads to decrease is a condition, by way of cause condition, for a state that leads to decrease.

original: Nevācayagāmināpacayagāmī hetu dhammo nevācayagāmināpacayagāmissa hetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: neva ācayagāmi na apacayagāmī hetu dhammaḥ neva ācayagāmi na apacayagāmissa hetussa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A cause that neither leads to increase nor to decrease is a condition, by way of cause condition, for a state that neither leads to increase nor to decrease.

original: Ācayagāmī hetu dhammo ācayagāmissa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. Ācayagāmī hetu dhammo nevācayagāmināpacayagāmissa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: ācaya gāmī hetu dhammo ācaya gāmissa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ ācaya gāmī hetu dhammo neva ācaya gāmi na apacaya gāmissa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo
translated: A causally arisen wholesome thought-arising is a condition, as object condition, for a causally arisen wholesome thought-arising. A causally arisen wholesome thought-arising is a condition, as object condition, for a causally arisen indeterminate thought-arising.🔽A causally arisen unwholesome thought-arising is a condition, as object condition, for a causally arisen unwholesome thought-arising. A causally arisen unwholesome thought-arising is a condition, as object condition, for a causally arisen indeterminate thought-arising.🔽A causally arisen indeterminate thought-arising is a condition, as object condition, for a causally arisen indeterminate thought-arising. A causally arisen indeterminate thought-arising is a condition, as object condition, for a causally arisen wholesome thought-arising.

original: Apacayagāmī hetu dhammo ācayagāmissa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. Apacayagāmī hetu dhammo nevācayagāmināpacayagāmissa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.🔽Nevācayagāmināpacayagāmī hetu dhammo nevācayagāmināpacayagāmissa hetussa dhammassa
analyzed: apacaya gāmī hetu dhammaḥ ācaya gāmissa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ apacaya gāmī hetu dhammaḥ na iva ācaya gāminā apacaya gāmissa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ  neva ācayagāmi na apacayagāmī hetu dhammaḥ neva ācayagāmi na apacayagāmissa hetussa dhammassa
translated: A causally arisen indeterminate thought-arising is a condition, as object condition, for a causally arisen unwholesome thought-arising.🔽A causally arisen wholesome thought-arising is a condition, as object condition, for a causally arisen wholesome thought-arising.🔽A causally arisen wholesome thought-arising is a condition, as object condition, for a causally arisen indeterminate thought-arising.🔽A causally arisen wholesome thought-arising is a condition, as object condition, for a causally arisen unwholesome thought-arising.🔽A causally arisen unwholesome thought-arising is a condition, as object condition, for a causally arisen unwholesome thought-arising.

original: ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. Nevācayagāmināpacayagāmī hetu dhammo ācayagāmissa hetussa🔽dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ na iva ācaya gāmi na apacaya gāmī hetu dhammo ācaya gāmissa hetussa  dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A causally arisen unwholesome thought-arising is a condition, as object condition, for a causally arisen indeterminate thought-arising.🔽A causally arisen unwholesome thought-arising is a condition, as object condition, for a causally arisen wholesome thought-arising.🔽A causally arisen indeterminate thought-arising is a condition, as object condition, for a causally arisen indeterminate thought-arising.

original: Ācayagāmī hetu dhammo ācayagāmissa hetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati, sahajātādhipati.
analyzed: ācaya gāmī hetu dhammo ācaya gāmissa hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati sahajāta adhipati
translated: A causally arisen indeterminate thought-arising is a condition, as object condition, for a causally arisen wholesome thought-arising.🔽A causally arisen indeterminate thought-arising is a condition, as object condition, for a causally arisen unwholesome thought-arising.

original: Apacayagāmī hetu dhammo apacayagāmissa hetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—sahajātādhipati
analyzed: apacaya gāmī hetu dhammaḥ apacaya gāmissa hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayo sahajāta adhipati
translated: A cause that is subject to decline is related to a cause that is subject to decline as a dominant condition. Conascence, predominance.

original: …. Apacayagāmī hetu dhammo ācayagāmissa hetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: apacaya gāmī hetu dhammaḥ ācaya gāmissa hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: …. A cause that is subject to decline is related to a cause that is subject to growth as a dominant condition.

original: Apacayagāmī hetu dhammo nevācayagāmināpacayagāmissa hetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena
analyzed: apacaya gāmī hetu dhammaḥ na iva ācaya gāminā apacaya gāmissa hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena
translated: A cause that is subject to decline is related to a cause that is neither subject to growth nor to decline as a dominant condition.

original: paccayo— ārammaṇādhipati ….🔽Nevācayagāmināpacayagāmī hetu dhammo nevācayagāmināpacayagāmissa hetussa dhammassa
analyzed: paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati  neva ācayagāmi na apacayagāmī hetu dhammaḥ neva ācayagāmi na apacayagāmissa hetussa dhammassa
translated: …. Object-predominance.

translated: A factor that is a cause is a condition, as proximate condition, for a factor that is neither increasing nor decreasing and for a factor that is decreasing.🔽A factor that is decreasing is a condition, as proximate condition, for a factor that is neither increasing nor decreasing and for a factor that is decreasing.

original: Nevācayagāmināpacayagāmī hetu dhammo nevācayagāmināpacayagāmissa hetussa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: neva ācayagāmi na apacayagāmī hetu dhammaḥ neva ācayagāmi na apacayagāmissa hetussa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhitta
translated: A factor that is neither increasing nor decreasing is a condition, as proximate condition, for a factor that is neither increasing nor decreasing. (Abbreviated.)

translated: (The section on the questions should be elaborated in detail here as in the case of the three wholesome roots.)

original: Hetu-ārammaṇa🔽Ācayagāmiṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ācayagāmī nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: hetu ārammaṇa  ācaya gāmim na hetum dhammam paṭicca ācaya gāmī na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: Root-cause and object🔽With an object that is not a root-cause and is conducive to accumulation, a state that is not a root-cause and is conducive to accumulation arises.

analyzed: ācaya gāmim na hetum dhammam paṭicca na iva ācaya gāminā apacaya gāmī na hetu dhammo uppajjati  hetu paccayā ācaya gāmim na hetum dhammam paṭicca ācaya gāmī na hetu ca na iva ācaya gāmi na apacaya gāmī
translated: With an object that is not a root-cause and is conducive to accumulation, a state that is not a root-cause and is neither conducive to accumulation nor to diminution arises.

analyzed: apacaya gāmim na hetum dhammam paṭicca na iva ācaya gāminā apacaya gāmī na hetu dhammo uppajjati  hetu paccayā apacaya gāmim na hetum dhammam paṭicca apacaya gāmī na hetu ca na iva ācaya gāmi na apacaya gāmī
translated: With an object that is not a root-cause and is conducive to diminution, a state that is not a root-cause and is neither conducive to accumulation nor to diminution arises.

original: nahetu ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.

original: Nevācayagāmināpacayagāmiṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nevācayagāmināpacayagāmī nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Ācayagāmiṁ nahetuñca nevācayagāmināpacayagāmiṁ nahetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca nevācayagāmināpacayagāmī nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
