original: Apacayagāmiṁ nahetuñca nevācayagāmināpacayagāmiṁ nahetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca nevācayagāmināpacayagāmī nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Ācayagāmiṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ācayagāmī nahetu dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā.🔽Apacayagāmiṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca apacayagāmī nahetu dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā.
analyzed: apacaya gāmim na hetum ca neva ācayagāminā apacayagāmim na hetum ca dhammam paṭicca neva ācayagāminā apacayagāmī na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā  ācaya gāmim na hetum dhammam paṭicca ācaya gāmī na hetu dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā  apacaya gāmim na hetum dhammam paṭicca apacaya gāmī na hetu dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā
translated: With a non-elevated neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling that is not a root condition as condition, a non-elevated neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling that is not a root condition arises.🔽With a non-elevated neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling that is not a root condition as condition, a non-elevated neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling that is not a root condition arises.

original: Nevācayagāmināpacayagāmiṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nevācayagāmināpacayagāmī nahetu dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇapaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: neva ācayagāmi na apacayagāmim na hetum dhammam paṭicca neva ācayagāmi na apacayagāmī na hetu dhammo uppajjati ārammaṇa paccayā
translated: With a non-elevated neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling that is not a root condition as condition, a non-elevated neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling that is not a root condition arises. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe tīṇi, adhipatiyā nava …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā nava pe vipāke ekam pe avigate nava saṅkhitta
translated: As condition, nine; as object, three; as predominance, nine; … as nutriment, one; … as faculty, three; … as path, one; … as association, three; … as non-disappearance, nine. (In brief.)

translated: Neither-greed-nor-non-greed …

original: (Sahajātavārampi …pe… sampayuttavārampi paṭiccavārasadisaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāram pi pe sampayutta vāram pi paṭicca vāra sadisam
translated: (The section on origination should be expanded in detail in the same way as the section on condition.)

original: Paccayacatukka
analyzed: paccaya catukka
translated: The four conditions

original: Ācayagāmī nahetu dhammo ācayagāmissa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: ācaya gāmī na hetu dhammaḥ ācaya gāmissa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A factor that leads to increase, not having a cause, is related to a factor that leads to increase, not having a cause, as object condition.

original: Ācayagāmī nahetu dhammo nevācayagāmināpacayagāmissa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: ācaya gāmī na hetu dhammaḥ na iva ācaya gāminā apacaya gāmissa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A factor that leads to increase, not having a cause, is related to a factor that neither leads to increase nor leads to decrease, not having a cause, as object condition.

original: Apacayagāmī nahetu dhammo ācayagāmissa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: apacaya gāmī na hetu dhammaḥ ācaya gāmissa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A factor that leads to decrease, not having a cause, is related to a factor that leads to increase, not having a cause, as object condition.

original: Apacayagāmī nahetu dhammo nevācayagāmināpacayagāmissa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.🔽Nevācayagāmināpacayagāmī nahetu dhammo nevācayagāmināpacayagāmissa nahetussa dhammassa
analyzed: apacaya gāmī na hetu dhammaḥ na iva ācayagāminā apacaya gāmissa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ  neva ācayagāmi na apacayagāmī na hetu dhammaḥ neva ācayagāmi na apacayagāmissa na hetussa dhammassa
translated: A factor that leads to decrease, not having a cause, is related to a factor that neither leads to increase nor leads to decrease, not having a cause, as object condition.

original: ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. Nevācayagāmināpacayagāmī nahetu dhammo ācayagāmissa nahetussa
analyzed: ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ na iva ācayagāmi na apacayagāmī na hetu dhammaḥ ācayagāmissa na hetussa
translated: A factor that neither leads to increase nor leads to decrease, not having a cause, is related to a factor that neither leads to increase nor leads to decrease, not having a cause, as object condition. A factor that neither leads to increase nor leads to decrease, not having a cause, is related to a factor that leads to increase, not having a cause, as object condition.

original: dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. Nevācayagāmināpacayagāmī nahetu dhammo apacayagāmissa
analyzed: dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ na iva ācayagāminā apacayagāmī na hetu dhammaḥ apacayagāmissa
translated: A state that is neither of increase nor of decrease is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is of decrease.

original: nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.🔽Ācayagāmī nahetu dhammo ācayagāmissa nahetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.🔽Apacayagāmī nahetu dhammo apacayagāmissa nahetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ  ācaya gāmī na hetu dhammaḥ ācaya gāmissa na hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi  apacaya gāmī na hetu dhammaḥ apacaya gāmissa na hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A state that is neither of increase nor of decrease is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is not a cause.🔽A state that is of increase is a condition, as predominance condition, for a state that is of increase that is not a cause. … three.🔽A state that is of decrease is a condition, as predominance condition, for a state that is of decrease that is not a cause.

original: Apacayagāmī nahetu dhammo ācayagāmissa nahetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo.🔽Apacayagāmī nahetu dhammo nevācayagāmināpacayagāmissa nahetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena
analyzed: apacaya gāmī na hetu dhammaḥ ācaya gāmissa na hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ  apacaya gāmī na hetu dhammaḥ na iva ācayagāminā apacaya gāmissa na hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena
translated: A state that is of decrease is a condition, as predominance condition, for a state that is of increase that is not a cause.🔽A state that is of decrease is a condition, as predominance condition, for a state that is neither of increase nor of decrease that is not a cause.

original: paccayo. Apacayagāmī nahetu dhammo apacayagāmissa nahetussa ca nevācayagāmināpacayagāmissa🔽nahetussa ca dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccayaḥ apacaya gāmī na hetu dhammaḥ apacaya gāmissa na hetussa ca na iva ācaya gāminā apacaya gāmissa 🔽na hetussa ca dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A state that is of decrease is a condition, as predominance condition, for a state that is of decrease that is not a cause and for a state that is neither of increase nor of decrease that is not a cause.

original: Nevācayagāmināpacayagāmī nahetu dhammo nevācayagāmināpacayagāmissa nahetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: neva ācayagāmi na apacayagāmī na hetu dhammaḥ neva ācayagāmi na apacayagāmissa na hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A state that is neither increase nor decrease which is not a root-cause is a condition, as a dominant condition, for a state that is neither increase nor decrease which is not a root-cause. … three.

original: Ācayagāmī nahetu dhammo ācayagāmissa nahetussa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo.🔽Ācayagāmī nahetu dhammo apacayagāmissa nahetussa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo.🔽Ācayagāmī nahetu dhammo nevācayagāmināpacayagāmissa nahetussa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo.

original: Apacayagāmī nahetu dhammo nevācayagāmināpacayagāmissa nahetussa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo.🔽Nevācayagāmināpacayagāmī nahetu dhammo nevācayagāmināpacayagāmissa nahetussa dhammassa

translated: A state that is decrease which is not a root-cause is a condition, as an immediately preceding condition, for a state that is neither increase nor decrease which is not a root-cause.🔽A state that is neither increase nor decrease which is not a root-cause is a condition, as an immediately preceding condition, for a state that is neither increase nor decrease which is not a root-cause.

original: anantarapaccayena paccayo. Nevācayagāmināpacayagāmī nahetu dhammo ācayagāmissa nahetussa
analyzed: anantara paccayena paccayaḥ na iva ācaya gāmi na apacaya gāmī na hetu dhammo ācaya gāmissa na hetussa
translated: A state that is neither increase nor decrease which is not a root-cause is a condition, as an immediately preceding condition, for a state that is increase which is not a root-cause.

analyzed: ācaya gāmī na hetu dhammo ācaya gāmissa na hetussa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhitta
translated: A state that is headed for accumulation and is not a root condition is a condition, as a decisive support condition, for a state that is headed for accumulation and is not a root condition. (In brief.)

original: Sekkhaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sekkho hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: sekkham hetum dhammam paṭicca sekkhaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A condition being a condition by way of root-cause condition, the condition is a condition by way of root-cause condition.🔽A condition being a condition by way of root-cause condition, the condition is a condition by way of object condition.🔽A condition being a condition by way of object condition, the condition is a condition by way of object condition.

original: Asekkhaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca asekkho hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: asekkham hetum dhammam paṭicca asekkhaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A condition being a condition by way of object condition, the condition is a condition by way of predominance condition.🔽A condition being a condition by way of object condition, the condition is a condition by way of proximity condition.🔽A condition being a condition by way of object condition, the condition is a condition by way of prenascence condition.🔽A condition being a condition by way of object condition, the condition is a condition by way of presence condition.🔽A condition being a condition by way of object condition, the condition is a condition by way of non-disappearance condition.

original: Nevasekkhanāsekkhaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nevasekkhanāsekkho hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: nevasekkha nāsekkham hetum dhammam paṭicca nevasekkha nāsekkhaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A condition being a condition by way of object condition, the condition is a condition by way of root-cause condition.🔽A condition being a condition by way of object condition, the condition is a condition by way of support condition.🔽A condition being a condition by way of object condition, the condition is a condition by way of faculty condition.🔽A condition being a condition by way of object condition, the condition is a condition by way of absorption condition.

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… āsevane dve …pe… avigate tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe āsevane dve pe avigate tīṇi
translated: A condition being a condition by way of object condition, the condition is a condition by way of path condition.🔽A condition being a condition by way of object condition, the condition is a condition by way of association condition.🔽A condition being a condition by way of object condition, the condition is a condition by way of non-association condition.🔽A condition being a condition by way of object condition, the condition is a condition by way of presence condition.

original: Naadhipatiyā tīṇi, napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, navipāke dve, navippayutte tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetupaccayā naadhipatiyā tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na adhipatiyā tīṇi na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na vipāke dve na vippayutte tīṇi  hetu paccayāḥ na adhipatiyā tīṇi
translated: A condition being a condition by way of object condition, the condition is a condition by way of non-disappearance condition.🔽A condition being a condition by way of object condition, the condition is a condition by way of root-cause condition.

original: Naadhipatipaccayā hetuyā tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na adhipati paccayā hetuyā tīṇi
translated: A condition being a condition by way of object condition, the condition is a condition by way of support condition.🔽A condition being a condition by way of object condition, the condition is a condition by way of faculty condition.

original: (Sahajātavārampi …pe… sampayuttavārampi vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāram pi pe sampayutta vāram pi
translated: A condition being a condition by way of object condition, the condition is a condition by way of absorption condition.

original: Hetu-ārammaṇādi
analyzed: hetu ārammaṇa ādi
translated: A condition being a condition by way of object

original: Sekkho hetu dhammo sekkhassa hetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.🔽Asekkho hetu dhammo asekkhassa hetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.🔽Nevasekkhanāsekkho hetu dhammo nevasekkhanāsekkhassa hetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: sekkhaḥ hetu dhammaḥ sekkhassa hetussa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ  asekkhaḥ hetu dhammaḥ asekkhassa hetussa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ  nevasekkha nāsekkhaḥ hetu dhammaḥ nevasekkha nāsekkhassa hetussa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A learner root cause is related to a learner root cause as a cause condition.🔽A non-learner root cause is related to a non-learner root cause as a cause condition.🔽A root cause that is neither a learner nor a non-learner is related to a root cause that is neither a learner nor a non-learner as a cause condition.

original: Sekkho hetu dhammo nevasekkhanāsekkhassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: sekkhaḥ hetu dhammaḥ nevasekkha nāsekkhassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A learner root cause is related to a root cause that is neither a learner nor a learner as a object condition.

original: Asekkho hetu dhammo nevasekkhanāsekkhassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.🔽Nevasekkhanāsekkho hetu dhammo nevasekkhanāsekkhassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.

translated: A non-learner root cause is related to a root cause that is neither a learner nor a non-learner as a object condition.🔽A root cause that is neither a learner nor a non-learner is related to a root cause that is neither a learner nor a non-learner as a object condition.

original: Sekkho hetu dhammo sekkhassa hetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo. Sekkho hetu dhammo nevasekkhanāsekkhassa hetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo.

translated: A learner root cause is related to a learner root cause as a dominant condition. A learner root cause is related to a root cause that is neither a learner nor a non-learner as a dominant condition.

original: Nahetuyā cuddasa, naārammaṇe cuddasa. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā cuddasa na ārammaṇe cuddasa saṅkhitta
translated: With the non-cause condition there are fourteen. With the non-object condition there are fourteen. (Abbreviated.)

original: Ārammaṇapaccayā nahetuyā pañca. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: ārammaṇa paccayāḥ na hetuyā pañca
translated: With the object condition there are five. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe pañca. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayāḥ ārammaṇe pañca saṅkhitta
translated: With the non-cause condition there are five. (Abbreviated.)🔽… As in the chapter on the wholesome triad.

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvāraṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)🔽4.1.12. Parittattika, Hetuduka
analyzed: yathā kusala attike pañhāvāraḥ evam  parittattika hetuduka
translated: … The limited triad, with cause

original: Parittaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca paritto hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: parittam hetum dhammam paṭicca parittaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a limited cause as condition there arises a limited cause. (Abbreviated.)

original: Mahaggataṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca mahaggato hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: mahaggatam hetum dhammam paṭicca mahaggataḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a great cause as condition there arises a great cause. (Abbreviated.)

original: Appamāṇaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca appamāṇo hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: appamāṇam hetum dhammam paṭicca appamāṇaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an immeasurable cause as condition there arises an immeasurable cause. (Abbreviated.)🔽With the cause condition there are three. With the object condition there are three. … With the inconstant condition there are three. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)

original: Naadhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… navippayutte tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na adhipatiyā tīṇi pe na vippayutte tīṇi
translated: With respect to the dominant condition there are three … With respect to the non-dependent condition there are three. (In brief.)

original: (Sahajātavārampi …pe… sampayuttavārampi paṭiccavārasadisaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāram pi pe sampayutta vāram pi paṭicca vāra sadisam
translated: (The section on the origination of the associated condition should be expanded as in the section on conditionality.)

original: Hetu-ārammaṇādi
analyzed: hetu ārammaṇa ādi
translated: Root-cause, object, etc.

original: Paritto hetu dhammo parittassa hetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: parittaḥ hetu dhammaḥ parittassa hetussa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A limited root-cause is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a limited root-cause.

original: Mahaggato hetu dhammo mahaggatassa hetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: mahaggataḥ hetu dhammaḥ mahaggatassa hetussa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ

original: Appamāṇo hetu dhammo appamāṇassa hetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.🔽Paritto hetu dhammo parittassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. Paritto hetu dhammo mahaggatassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.

translated: An immeasurable is a condition, as root-cause condition, for an immeasurable root-cause.🔽A limited root-cause is a condition, as object condition, for a limited root-cause. A limited root-cause is a condition, as object condition, for a great root-cause.

original: Mahaggato hetu dhammo mahaggatassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. Mahaggato hetu dhammo parittassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: mahaggataḥ hetu dhammaḥ mahaggatassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ mahaggataḥ hetu dhammo parittassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A great root-cause is a condition, as object condition, for a great root-cause. A great root-cause is a condition, as object condition, for a limited root-cause.

original: Appamāṇo hetu dhammo parittassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. Appamāṇo hetu dhammo mahaggatassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: appamāṇaḥ hetu dhammaḥ parittassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ appamāṇaḥ hetu dhammaḥ mahaggatassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A great cause is related to a limited cause as object condition. A great cause is related to a great cause as object condition.

original: Paritto hetu dhammo parittassa hetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo.🔽Mahaggato hetu dhammo mahaggatassa hetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo. Mahaggato hetu dhammo parittassa hetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo.

analyzed: appamāṇaḥ hetu dhammaḥ appamāṇassa hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ dve  parittaḥ hetu dhammo parittassa hetussa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ parittaḥ

original: dhammo appamāṇassa hetussa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo.🔽Mahaggato hetu dhammo mahaggatassa hetussa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo. Mahaggato🔽hetu dhammo parittassa hetussa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo. Mahaggato hetu

original: dhammo appamāṇassa hetussa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo.🔽Appamāṇo hetu dhammo appamāṇassa hetussa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo. Appamāṇo
analyzed: dhammaḥ appamāṇassa hetussa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ  appamāṇaḥ hetu dhammaḥ appamāṇassa hetussa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ appamāṇaḥ
translated: A great object is related to an immeasurable object as an immediately preceding condition.🔽An immeasurable object is related to an immeasurable object as an immediately preceding condition.

analyzed: dhammaḥ mahaggatassa hetussa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: An immeasurable object is related to a great object as an immediately preceding condition.

analyzed: parittaḥ hetu dhammo parittassa hetussa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ

analyzed: appamāṇam na hetum dhammam paṭicca appamāṇaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā appamāṇa  na hetum dhammam paṭicca parittaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā appamāṇam na hetu
translated: … with a great cause …

original: Hetuyā terasa, ārammaṇe pañca, adhipatiyā nava …pe… sahajāte terasa, aññamaññe satta …pe… purejāte āsevane tīṇi …pe… vigate pañca, avigate terasa. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nahetu🔽Parittaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca paritto nahetu dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe pañca, naadhipatiyā dasa, napurejāte dvādasa, napacchājāte
analyzed: hetuyā terasa ārammaṇe pañca adhipatiyā nava pe sahajāte terasa aññamaññe satta pe purejāte āsevane tīṇi pe vigate pañca avigate terasa saṅkhitta  na hetu  parittam na hetum dhammam paṭicca parittaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati na hetu paccayā  na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe pañca na adhipatiyā dasa na purejāte dvādasa na pacchājāte
translated: With respect to cause, there are thirteen; with respect to object, there are five; with respect to predominance, there are nine. … With respect to presence, there are thirteen; with respect to mutuality, there are seven. … With respect to prenascence, there are three; with respect to postnascence, there are five; with respect to repetition, there are thirteen. … With respect to absence, there are five; with respect to disappearance, there are thirteen. (In brief.)

original: naāsevane terasa, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke nava, naāhāre naindriye najhāne namagge🔽ekaṁ …pe… navippayutte tīṇi …pe… novigate pañca. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na āsevane terasa na kamme tīṇi na vipāke nava na āhāre na indriye na jhāne na magge  ekam pe na vippayutte tīṇi pe no vigate pañca
translated: With respect to non-cause, there is one; with respect to non-object, there are five; with respect to non-predominance, there are ten; with respect to non-preatises, there are twelve; with respect to non-conascence, there are thirteen; with respect to non-kamma, there are three; with respect to non-result, there are nine; with respect to non-nutriment, there are nine; with respect to non-faculty, there are nine; with respect to non-path, there is one; with respect to non-jhāna, there are nine; with respect to non-absorption, there are nine; with respect to non-restraint, there are nine; with respect to non-indeterminate, there are nine; with respect to non-root, there are nine; with respect to non-condition, there are nine; with respect to non-deprivation, there are nine; with respect to non-disappearance, there are five. (In brief.)

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe pañca. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe pañca  na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe eka saṅkhitta
translated: With respect to cause, there are five; with respect to non-object, there are five. (In brief.)🔽With respect to non-cause, there is one; with respect to object, there is one. (In brief.)

original: (Sahajātavārampi …pe… sampayuttavārampi paṭiccavārasadisaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāram pi pe sampayutta vāram pi paṭicca vāra sadisam
translated: (The section on conascence, etc., is to be elaborated in detail according to the method of the Dependent Origination Triad.)

original: Paccayacatukka
analyzed: paccaya catukka
translated: The fourfold condition

original: Paritto nahetu dhammo parittassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. Paritto nahetu dhammo mahaggatassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.

translated: A limited, not-root-cause dhammā is related to a limited, not-root-cause dhammā by way of object condition. A limited, not-root-cause dhammā is related to a great, not-root-cause dhammā by way of object condition.

original: Mahaggato nahetu dhammo mahaggatassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. Mahaggato nahetu dhammo parittassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.🔽Appamāṇo nahetu dhammo appamāṇassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: mahaggataḥ na hetu dhammaḥ mahaggatassa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ mahaggataḥ na hetu dhammo parittassa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ  appamāṇaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ appamāṇassa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A great, not-root-cause dhammā is related to a great, not-root-cause dhammā by way of object condition. A great, not-root-cause dhammā is related to a limited, not-root-cause dhammā by way of object condition.🔽An immeasurable, not-root-cause dhammā is related to an immeasurable, not-root-cause dhammā by way of object condition.

original: Appamāṇo nahetu dhammo parittassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.🔽Appamāṇo nahetu dhammo mahaggatassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: appamāṇaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ parittassa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ  appamāṇaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ mahaggatassa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: An immeasurable, not-root-cause dhammā is related to a limited, not-root-cause dhammā by way of object condition.🔽An immeasurable, not-root-cause dhammā is related to a great, not-root-cause dhammā by way of object condition.

original: Paritto nahetu dhammo parittassa nahetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: parittaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ parittassa na hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhitta
translated: A limited, not-root-cause dhammā is related to a limited, not-root-cause dhammā by way of predominance condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Ārammaṇe satta, adhipatiyā satta, anantare nava, samanantare nava, sahajāte ekādasa,🔽aññamaññe satta, nissaye terasa, upanissaye nava, purejāte pacchājāte tīṇi, āsevane
analyzed: ārammaṇe satta adhipatiyā satta anantare nava samanantare nava sahajāte ekādasa  aññamaññe satta nissaye terasa upanissaye nava purejāte pacchājāte tīṇi āsevane
translated: as mutuality 7, as support 13, as decisive support 9, as prenascence 3, as postnascence 3, as repetition 3,🔽as kamma 4, as nutriment 4, as faculty 4, as jhāna 4, as path 4, as association 3, as dissociation 5,

translated: as presence 5, as absence 5, as disappearance 5, as non-disappearance 5, as object 7, as non-cause 15,🔽as object 7, as non-adhipati 7, as non-anantara 7, as non-sahajāta 7, as non-sahabhū 7, as non-āsevana 7,🔽as non-kammas 7, as non-vipāka 7, as non-āhāras 7, as non-indriya 7, as non-maggas 7, as non-saṃyojana 7, as non-sampayutta 7, as non-vigata 7.🔽As non-cause 15, as non-object 15.🔽As object 7, as non-cause 7.

original: Nahetuyā pannarasa, naārammaṇe pannarasa. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Ārammaṇapaccayā nahetuyā satta. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe satta. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)

translated: As non-cause 7, as object 7.

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvāraṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: yathā kusala attike pañhāvāraḥ evam
translated: (The section on the questions should be elaborated in detail here in the same way as in the case of the wholesome triad.)

original: 4.1.13. Parittārammaṇattika, Hetuduka

original: Parittārammaṇo hetu dhammo parittārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: paritta ārammaṇaḥ hetu dhammo paritta ārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: A condition being a limited object condition for a limited object condition …

original: paccayo. Parittārammaṇo hetu dhammo mahaggatārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.🔽Mahaggatārammaṇo hetu dhammo mahaggatārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: paccayaḥ paritta ārammaṇaḥ hetu dhammaḥ mahaggata ārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ  mahaggata ārammaṇaḥ hetu dhammaḥ mahaggata ārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: A factor that is a cause and has a limited object is related to a factor that is a cause and has a limited object as object condition. A factor that is a cause and has a limited object is related to a factor that is a cause and has a great object as object condition.

original: paccayo. Mahaggatārammaṇo hetu dhammo parittārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.🔽Appamāṇārammaṇo hetu dhammo appamāṇārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: paccayaḥ mahaggata ārammaṇaḥ hetu dhammo paritta ārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ  appamāṇa ārammaṇaḥ hetu dhammaḥ appamāṇa ārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: A factor that is a cause and has a great object is related to a factor that is a cause and has a great object as object condition. A factor that is a cause and has a great object is related to a factor that is a cause and has a limited object as object condition.

original: paccayo. Appamāṇārammaṇo hetu dhammo parittārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: paccayaḥ appamāṇa ārammaṇaḥ hetu dhammo paritta ārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: A factor that is a cause and has an immeasurable object is related to a factor that is a cause and has an immeasurable object as object condition. A factor that is a cause and has an immeasurable object is related to a factor that is a cause and has a limited object as object condition.

original: paccayo. Appamāṇārammaṇo hetu dhammo mahaggatārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena🔽paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: paccayaḥ appamāṇa ārammaṇaḥ hetu dhammaḥ mahaggata ārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena 🔽paccayaḥ saṅkhitta
translated: A factor that is a cause and has an immeasurable object is related to a factor that is a cause and has a great object as object condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe satta, adhipatiyā satta, anantare nava, samanantare nava, sahajāte
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe satta adhipatiyā satta anantare nava samanantare nava sahajāte
translated: With respect to cause there are three, with respect to object there are seven, with respect to predominance there are seven, with respect to proximity there are nine, with respect to contiguity there are nine, with respect to arising together there are nine,

original: aññamaññe nissaye tīṇi, upanissaye nava, āsevane pañca, vipāke tīṇi, indriye magge
analyzed: aññamaññe nissaye tīṇi upanissaye nava āsevane pañca vipāke tīṇi indriye magge
translated: with respect to presence there are nine, with respect to non-disappearance there are nine, with respect to kamma there are three, with respect to nutriment there are three, with respect to faculty there are three, with respect to jhāna there are three, with respect to path there are three,

original: sampayutte tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: sampayutte tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: with respect to association there are three, with respect to dissociation there are three, with respect to presence there are three, with respect to absence there are three, with respect to non-disappearance there are three.

original: Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: With respect to non-cause there are nine, with respect to non-object there are nine.

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe tīṇi
translated: With respect to cause and not object there are three.

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe satta. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayāḥ ārammaṇe satta saṅkhitta
translated: With respect to non-cause and object there are seven.

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvāraṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: yathā kusala attike pañhāvāraḥ evam
translated: (The section on the question in brief is to be expanded as in the case of the three wholesome kinds of consciousness.)

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Cause

original: Parittārammaṇaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca parittārammaṇo nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: paritta ārammaṇam na hetum dhammam paṭicca paritta ārammaṇaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: With respect to a non-cause object that is limited, a non-cause object that is limited arises, by way of the relation of cause.

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With respect to cause there are three, with respect to object there are three, with respect to predominance there are three, with respect to non-disappearance there are three.

translated: A state that is great, not a root cause, is related to a state that is limited, not a root cause, as object condition.

analyzed: paccayaḥ appamāṇa ārammaṇaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ mahaggata ārammaṇassa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ

analyzed: paritta ārammaṇaḥ na hetu dhammo paritta ārammaṇassa na hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhitta

original: Maggārammaṇo hetu ca maggādhipati hetu ca dhammā maggārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: magga ārammaṇaḥ hetu ca magga adhipati hetu ca dhammā magga ārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A wholesome root-cause dhammā that is an object of a path and a wholesome root-cause dhammā that is a dominant condition for a path are a condition, as root-cause condition, for a wholesome root-cause dhammā that is an object of a path. … There are three.

original: Maggahetuko hetu ca maggādhipati hetu ca dhammā maggahetukassa hetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: magga hetukaḥ hetu ca magga adhipati hetu ca dhammā magga hetukassa hetussa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: Factors that are causes of the path are related to a cause that is a cause of the path as a supporting condition in three ways.

original: Maggahetuko hetu dhammo maggārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: magga hetukaḥ hetu dhammaḥ magga ārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A factor that is a cause of the path is related to a cause that has the path as its object as a supporting condition.

original: Maggahetuko hetu dhammo maggādhipatissa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.🔽Maggahetuko hetu dhammo maggārammaṇassa hetussa ca maggādhipatissa hetussa ca dhammassa
analyzed: magga hetukaḥ hetu dhammaḥ magga adhipatissa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo  magga hetukaḥ hetu dhammaḥ magga ārammaṇassa hetussa ca magga adhipatissa hetussa ca dhammassa
translated: A factor that is a cause of the path is related to a cause that has the path as its dominant condition as a supporting condition.

original: ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.🔽Maggādhipati hetu dhammo maggādhipatissa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.🔽Maggahetuko hetu ca maggādhipati hetu ca dhammā maggārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ  magga adhipati hetu dhammaḥ magga adhipatissa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi  magga hetukaḥ hetu ca magga adhipati hetu ca dhammā magga ārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A factor that is a cause of the path is related to a cause that has the path as its object and to a cause that has the path as its dominant condition as a supporting condition.🔽A factor that is a cause that has the path as its dominant condition is related to a cause that has the path as its dominant condition as a supporting condition in three ways.🔽Factors that are causes of the path and a cause that has the path as its dominant condition are related to a cause that has the path as its object as a supporting condition in three ways.

original: Maggārammaṇo hetu dhammo maggārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: magga ārammaṇaḥ hetu dhammaḥ magga ārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A factor that has the path as its object is related to a cause that has the path as its object as a dominant condition in three ways.

original: Maggahetuko hetu dhammo maggahetukassa hetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo … pañca.🔽Maggādhipati hetu dhammo maggādhipatissa hetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo … pañca.
analyzed: magga hetukaḥ hetu dhammaḥ magga hetukassa hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ pañca  magga adhipati hetu dhammaḥ magga adhipatissa hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ pañca
translated: A cause that is a cause of what is supported by the path is related to a cause that is a cause of what is supported by the path as a dominant condition … five.

original: Maggārammaṇo hetu ca maggādhipati hetu ca dhammā maggārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: magga ārammaṇaḥ hetu ca magga adhipati hetu ca dhammā magga ārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A cause that is a cause of what has the path as its object and a cause that is a cause of what is supported by the path are related to a cause that is a cause of what has the path as its object as a dominant condition … three.

original: Maggahetuko hetu ca maggādhipati hetu ca dhammā maggārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo … pañca.
analyzed: magga hetukaḥ hetu ca magga adhipati hetu ca dhammā magga ārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ pañca
translated: A cause that is a cause of the path and a cause that is a cause of what is supported by the path are related to a cause that is a cause of what has the path as its object as a dominant condition … five.

original: Maggārammaṇo hetu dhammo maggārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.🔽Maggādhipati hetu dhammo maggādhipatissa hetussa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: magga ārammaṇaḥ hetu dhammaḥ magga ārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi 🔽magga adhipati hetu dhammaḥ magga adhipatissa hetussa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A cause that is a cause of what has the path as its object is related to a cause that is a cause of what has the path as its object as an immediately preceding condition … three.🔽A cause that is a cause of what is supported by the path is related to a cause that is a cause of what is supported by the path as an immediately preceding condition … three.

original: Maggārammaṇo hetu ca maggādhipati hetu ca dhammā maggārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: magga ārammaṇaḥ hetu ca magga adhipati hetu ca dhammā magga ārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A cause that has the path as its object is related to a cause that has the path as its object by way of the condition being antecedent and by way of the condition being prior and by way of the condition being decisive support. … (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā sattarasa, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā ekavīsa, anantare nava, samanantare nava,🔽sahajāte sattarasa, aññamaññe sattarasa, nissaye sattarasa, upanissaye ekavīsa, āsevane
analyzed: hetuyā sattarasa ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā ekavīsa anantare nava samanantare nava  sahajāte sattarasa aññamaññe sattarasa nissaye sattarasa upanissaye ekavīsa āsevane
translated: In the section on cause there are seventeen. In the section on object there are nine. In the section on predominance there are twenty-one. In the section on proximity there are nine.

original: nava, indriye magge sampayutte sattarasa …pe… avigate sattarasa. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: nava indriye magge sampayutte sattarasa pe avigate sattarasa
translated: In the section on contiguity there are nine. In the section on presence there are seventeen. In the section on absence there are seventeen. In the section on disappearance there are seventeen. In the section on non-disappearance there are seventeen. In the section on root cause there are seventeen. In the section on result there are seventeen. In the section on nutriment there are seventeen. In the section on faculty there are seventeen. In the section on path there are seventeen. In the section on association there are seventeen. … In the section on non-disappearance there are seventeen. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetuyā ekavīsa, naārammaṇe sattarasa. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā ekavīsa na ārammaṇe sattarasa
translated: In the section on not a cause there are twenty-one. In the section on not an object there are seventeen. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe sattarasa. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe sattarasa
translated: In the section on cause as condition not object there are seventeen. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: In the section on not a cause as condition object there are nine. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvāraṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: yathā kusala attike pañhāvāraḥ evam
translated: (The section is to be expanded in the same way as the “Questions” section in the chapter on the three wholesome roots.)

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Cause

original: Maggārammaṇaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca maggārammaṇo nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: magga ārammaṇam na hetum dhammam paṭicca magga ārammaṇaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A state that is not a cause that has the path as its object is related to a state that is not a cause that has the path as its object by way of the condition being object.

original: Maggārammaṇaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca maggādhipati nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: magga ārammaṇam na hetum dhammam paṭicca magga adhipati na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a path as object, with no cause, a state of no cause that is a path-predominance condition arises.

original: Maggārammaṇaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca maggārammaṇo nahetu ca maggādhipati nahetu🔽ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.
analyzed: magga ārammaṇam na hetum dhammam paṭicca magga ārammaṇaḥ na hetu ca magga adhipati na hetu  ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā
translated: With a path as object, with no cause, a state of no cause that is a path-predominance condition arises.🔽With a path as object, with no cause, a state of no cause that is a path-predominance condition arises.

original: Maggahetukaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca maggahetuko nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Maggahetukaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca maggādhipati nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: magga hetukam na hetum dhammam paṭicca magga hetukaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā  magga hetukam na hetum dhammam paṭicca magga adhipati na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a path as object, with no cause, a state of no cause that is a path-predominance condition arises.🔽With a path as object, with no cause, a state of no cause that is a path-predominance condition arises.

original: Maggahetukaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca maggahetuko nahetu ca maggādhipati nahetu ca
analyzed: magga hetukam na hetum dhammam paṭicca magga hetukaḥ na hetu ca magga adhipati na hetu ca
translated: With a path as object, with no cause, a state of no cause that is a path-predominance condition arises.

original: dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.🔽Maggādhipatiṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca maggādhipati nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā  magga adhipatim na hetum dhammam paṭicca magga adhipati na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a path as object, with no cause, a state of no cause that is a path-predominance condition arises.🔽With a path as object, with no cause, a state of no cause that is a path-predominance condition arises.

original: Maggādhipatiṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca maggārammaṇo nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: magga adhipatim na hetum dhammam paṭicca magga ārammaṇaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a path as object, with no cause, a state of no cause that is a path-predominance condition arises.

original: Maggādhipatiṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca maggahetuko nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Maggādhipatiṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca maggārammaṇo nahetu ca maggādhipati nahetu🔽ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā. Maggādhipatiṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca maggahetuko

With a path-dominant and not a cause as condition, a path-cause and not a cause and a path-object and not a cause and a path-dominant and not a cause arise.

translated: With a path-dominant and not a cause as condition, a path-cause and not a cause arises.

original: maggādhipatiṁ nahetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca maggārammaṇo nahetu ca maggādhipati nahetu🔽ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.
analyzed: magga adhipatim na hetuñca dhammam paṭicca magga ārammaṇaḥ na hetu ca magga adhipati na hetu 🔽ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā

With a path-dominant and not a cause as condition, a path-cause and not a cause and a path-dominant and not a cause arise.🔽With a path-object and not a cause and a path-dominant and not a cause as condition, a path-object and not a cause arises. With a path-object and not a cause and a path-dominant and not a cause as condition, a path-object and not a cause and a path-dominant and not a cause arise.

original: Maggahetukaṁ nahetuñca maggādhipatiṁ nahetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca maggahetuko nahetu🔽dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Maggahetukaṁ nahetuñca maggādhipatiṁ nahetuñca dhammaṁ🔽paṭicca maggādhipati nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Maggahetukaṁ nahetuñca

translated: With a path condition and without cause as condition, a path condition without cause arises. With a path condition and without cause as condition, a path-adhipati condition without cause arises. With a path condition and without cause as condition, a non-path condition without cause arises.

original: paccayo. Maggādhipati nahetu dhammo maggārammaṇassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: paccayaḥ magga adhipati na hetu dhammaḥ magga ārammaṇassa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: A path dominant immediately precedes a path object.🔽A path dominant is related to a path object that is not a cause by way of object condition.

original: paccayo. Maggādhipati nahetu dhammo maggārammaṇassa nahetussa ca maggādhipatissa🔽nahetussa ca dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.🔽Maggahetuko nahetu ca maggādhipati nahetu ca dhammā maggārammaṇassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: paccayaḥ magga adhipati na hetu dhammaḥ magga ārammaṇassa na hetussa ca magga adhipatissa  na hetussa ca dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ  magga hetukaḥ na hetu ca magga adhipati na hetu ca dhammā magga ārammaṇassa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A path dominant is related to a path object that is not a cause and to a path dominant that is not a cause by way of object condition.🔽A path cause and a path dominant that are not a cause are related to a path object that is not a cause by way of object condition. … three.

original: Maggārammaṇo nahetu dhammo maggārammaṇassa nahetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: magga ārammaṇaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ magga ārammaṇassa na hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A path object that is not a cause is related to a path object that is not a cause by way of predominance condition. … three.

original: Maggahetuko nahetu dhammo maggahetukassa nahetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: magga hetukaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ magga hetukassa na hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A path cause that is not a cause is related to a path cause that is not a cause by way of predominance condition.

original: Maggahetuko nahetu dhammo maggārammaṇassa nahetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: magga hetukaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ magga ārammaṇassa na hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A path cause that is not a cause is related to a path object that is not a cause by way of predominance condition.

original: Maggahetuko nahetu dhammo maggādhipatissa nahetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo.🔽Maggahetuko nahetu dhammo maggārammaṇassa nahetussa ca maggādhipatissa nahetussa🔽ca dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo. Maggahetuko nahetu dhammo maggahetukassa
analyzed: magga hetukaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ magga adhipatissa na hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ  magga hetukaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ magga ārammaṇassa na hetussa ca magga adhipatissa na hetussa  ca dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ magga hetukaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ magga hetukassa
translated: A state that is a cause of the path and is not a root cause is related to a state that is a condition arisen from conditions and is not a root cause as a predominance condition.

original: nahetussa ca maggādhipatissa nahetussa ca dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: na hetussa ca magga adhipatissa na hetussa ca dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A state that is a cause of the path and is not a root cause is related to a state that is a condition arisen from conditions and is not a root cause, and to a state that is a condition arisen from conditions and is a predominance of the path, as a predominance condition. A state that is a cause of the path and is not a root cause is related to a state that is a condition arisen from conditions and is a cause of the path, and to a state that is a condition arisen from conditions and is a predominance of the path, as a predominance condition.

original: Maggādhipati nahetu dhammo maggādhipatissa nahetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo … pañca.
analyzed: magga adhipati na hetu dhammaḥ magga adhipatissa na hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ pañca
translated: A state that is a predominance of the path and is not a root cause is related to a state that is a condition arisen from conditions and is a predominance of the path, and is not a root cause, as a predominance condition … five.

original: Maggārammaṇo nahetu ca maggādhipati nahetu ca dhammā maggārammaṇassa nahetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: magga ārammaṇaḥ na hetu ca magga adhipati na hetu ca dhammā magga ārammaṇassa na hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A state that is a condition arisen from conditions and is not a root cause, and a state that is a predominance of the path and is not a root cause, are related to a state that is a condition arisen from conditions and is not a root cause as a predominance condition … three.

original: Maggahetuko nahetu ca maggādhipati nahetu ca dhammā maggahetukassa nahetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo … pañca.
analyzed: magga hetukaḥ na hetu ca magga adhipati na hetu ca dhammā magga hetukassa na hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ pañca
translated: A state that is a cause of the path and is not a root cause, and a state that is a predominance of the path and is not a root cause, are related to a state that is a condition arisen from conditions and is a cause of the path, as a predominance condition … five.

original: Anantara-upanissaya
analyzed: anantara aupanissaya
translated: Successive and decisive support conditions

original: Maggārammaṇo nahetu dhammo maggārammaṇassa nahetussa dhammassa anantarapaccayena🔽paccayo. Maggārammaṇo nahetu dhammo maggādhipatissa nahetussa dhammassa anantarapaccayena
analyzed: magga ārammaṇaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ magga ārammaṇassa na hetussa dhammassa anantara paccayena  paccayaḥ magga ārammaṇaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ magga adhipatissa na hetussa dhammassa anantara paccayena
translated: A state that is not a root cause and has the path as its object is a condition, as proximate condition, for a state that is not a root cause and has the path as its object.🔽A state that is not a root cause and has the path as its object is a condition, as proximate condition, for a state that is not a root cause and has supremacy over the path.

original: paccayo. Maggārammaṇo nahetu dhammo maggārammaṇassa nahetussa ca maggādhipatissa🔽nahetussa ca dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo.🔽Maggādhipati nahetu dhammo maggādhipatissa nahetussa dhammassa anantarapaccayena
analyzed: paccayaḥ magga ārammaṇaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ magga ārammaṇassa na hetussa ca magga adhipatissa  na hetussa ca dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ  magga adhipati na hetu dhammaḥ magga adhipatissa na hetussa dhammassa anantara paccayena
translated: A state that is not a root cause and has the path as its object is a condition, as proximate condition, for a state that is not a root cause and has the path as its object and for a state that is not a root cause and has supremacy over the path.🔽A state that is not a root cause and has supremacy over the path is a condition, as proximate condition, for a state that is not a root cause and has supremacy over the path.

original: paccayo. Maggādhipati nahetu dhammo maggārammaṇassa nahetussa dhammassa anantarapaccayena🔽paccayo. Maggādhipati nahetu dhammo maggārammaṇassa nahetussa ca maggādhipatissa
analyzed: paccayaḥ magga adhipati na hetu dhammaḥ magga ārammaṇassa na hetussa dhammassa anantara paccayena  paccayaḥ magga adhipati na hetu dhammaḥ magga ārammaṇassa na hetussa ca magga adhipatissa
translated: A state that is not a root cause and has supremacy over the path is a condition, as proximate condition, for a state that is not a root cause and has the path as its object.

original: nahetussa ca dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: na hetussa ca dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A state that is not a root cause and has supremacy over the path is a condition, as proximate condition, for a state that is not a root cause and has the path as its object and for a state that is not a root cause and has supremacy over the path.

original: Maggārammaṇo nahetu ca maggādhipati nahetu ca dhammā maggārammaṇassa nahetussa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi …pe….
analyzed: magga ārammaṇaḥ na hetu ca magga adhipati na hetu ca dhammā magga ārammaṇassa na hetussa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi pe
translated: A state that is neither a root nor a condition for a root and that is neither a root nor a condition for a root is a condition, by way of proximity condition, for a state that is neither a root nor a condition for a root. … three …

original: Maggārammaṇo nahetu dhammo maggārammaṇassa nahetussa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: magga ārammaṇaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ magga ārammaṇassa na hetussa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A state that is neither a root nor a condition for a root is a condition, by way of decisive support condition, for a state that is neither a root nor a condition for a root. … three.

original: Maggahetuko nahetu dhammo maggahetukassa nahetussa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo … pañca.🔽Maggādhipati nahetu dhammo maggādhipatissa nahetussa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo … pañca.🔽Maggārammaṇo nahetu ca maggādhipati nahetu ca dhammā maggārammaṇassa nahetussa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: magga hetukaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ magga hetukassa na hetussa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ pañca  magga adhipati na hetu dhammaḥ magga adhipatissa na hetussa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ pañca  magga ārammaṇaḥ na hetu ca magga adhipati na hetu ca dhammā magga ārammaṇassa na hetussa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A state that is a root and is not a condition for a root is a condition, by way of decisive support condition, for a state that is a root and is not a condition for a root. … five.🔽A state that is a condition for a root and is not a root is a condition, by way of decisive support condition, for a state that is a condition for a root and is not a root. … five.🔽A state that is neither a root nor a condition for a root and a state that is a condition for a root and is not a root are a condition, by way of decisive support condition, for a state that is a condition for a root and is not a root. … five.

original: Maggahetuko nahetu ca maggādhipati nahetu ca dhammā maggahetukassa nahetussa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo … pañca. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: magga hetukaḥ na hetu ca magga adhipati na hetu ca dhammā magga hetukassa na hetussa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ pañca
translated: A state that is a root and is not a condition for a root and a state that is a condition for a root and is not a root are a condition, by way of decisive support condition, for a state that is a root and is not a condition for a root. … five. (Abbreviated.)

original: Ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā ekavīsa, anantare nava, samanantare nava, sahajāte sattarasa,
analyzed: ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā ekavīsa anantare nava samanantare nava sahajāte sattarasa
translated: As object 9, as dominant 21, as proximate 9, as prenascent 9, as conascent 17,

original: aññamaññe sattarasa, nissaye sattarasa, upanissaye ekavīsa, āsevane nava, kamme sattarasa,
analyzed: aññamaññe sattarasa nissaye sattarasa upanissaye ekavīsa āsevane nava kamme sattarasa
translated: as postnascent 17, as support 17, as object of clinging 21, as repetition 9, as kamma 17,

original: āhāre indriye jhāne magge sampayutte sattarasa …pe… avigate sattarasa. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: āhāre indriye jhāne magge sampayutte sattarasa pe avigate sattarasa
translated: as nutriment 17, as faculty 17, as jhāna 17, as path 17, as association 17, … as non-disappearance 17. (In brief:)

original: Nahetuyā ekavīsa, naārammaṇe sattarasa. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Ārammaṇapaccayā nahetuyā nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā ekavīsa na ārammaṇe sattarasa  ārammaṇa paccayā na hetuyā nava
translated: As non-cause 21, as non-object 7. (In brief:)🔽As object condition, as non-cause 9. (In brief:)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽(Yathā kusalattike pañhāvāraṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta  yathā kusala attike pañhāvāraḥ evam
translated: As non-cause condition, as object 9. (In brief:)

original: 4.1.17. Uppannattika, Hetuduka
analyzed: uppanna ttika hetu duka
translated: … As arising, as cause

original: Hetvādi
analyzed: hetu ādi
translated: As cause, etc.

original: Uppanno hetu dhammo uppannassa hetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo— uppannā hetū sampayuttakānaṁ hetūnaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….
analyzed: uppannaḥ hetu dhammaḥ uppannassa hetussa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ uppannāḥ hetū sampayuttakānam hetūnam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe
translated: An arisen cause dhamma is a condition, as cause condition, for an arisen cause dhamma. Arisen causes are a condition, as cause condition, for the associated causes. At the moment of rebirth-linking …

original: Anuppanno hetu dhammo uppannassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo— anuppannā🔽hetū cetopariyañāṇassa anāgataṁsañāṇassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. Uppādī hetu dhammo
analyzed: anuppannaḥ hetu dhammaḥ uppannassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ anuppannā  hetū cetas pariya ñāṇassa anāgata sañāṇassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo uppādī hetu dhammo
translated: An unarisen cause is a condition, as object condition, for an arisen cause.🔽The unarisen causes are a condition, as object condition, for knowledge of penetration of minds and for knowledge of past lives.🔽An arising cause is a condition, as object condition, for an arisen cause.

original: uppannassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo— uppādī hetū cetopariyañāṇassa🔽anāgataṁsañāṇassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: uppannassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ uppādī hetū cetas pariya ñāṇassa  anāgata sañāṇassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo
translated: The arising causes are a condition, as object condition, for knowledge of penetration of minds and for knowledge of past lives.

original: Uppanno hetu dhammo uppannassa hetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: uppannaḥ hetu dhammaḥ uppannassa hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: An arisen cause is a condition, as predominance condition, for an arisen cause. … three.

original: Sahajātapaccayena paccayo … aññamaññapaccayena paccayo … nissayapaccayena paccayo🔽… upanissayapaccayena paccayo … vipākapaccayena paccayo … indriyapaccayena paccayo
analyzed: sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ  upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ vipāka paccayena paccayaḥ indriya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: It is a condition, as conascence condition, … as mutuality condition, … as support condition, …🔽as decisive support condition, … as kamma condition, … as nutriment condition, … as faculty condition, …

original: … maggapaccayena paccayo … sampayuttapaccayena paccayo … atthipaccayena paccayo …pe…
analyzed: magga paccayena paccao sampayutta paccayena paccayo atthi paccayena paccayo pe
translated: as path condition, … as association condition, … as presence condition, … and so on as in §10 …

original: avigatapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: avigata paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: as non-disappearance condition.

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe dve, adhipatiyā tīṇi, sahajāte ekaṁ, aññamaññe ekaṁ, nissaye ekaṁ, upanissaye dve …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe dve adhipatiyā tīṇi sahajāte eka aññamaññe eka nissaye eka upanissaye dve pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: As condition being one, as object being two, as predominance being three, as conascence being one, as mutuality being one, as support being one, as nutriment being two, … as non-hindrance being one. (In brief.)

original: Nahetuyā dve, naārammaṇe dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā dve na ārammaṇe dve
translated: As non-condition being two, as non-object being two. (In brief.)

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe eka saṅkhitta
translated: As condition being one, as non-object being one. (In brief.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe dve
translated: As non-condition being two, as object being two. (In brief.)

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvāraṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: yathā kusala attike pañhāvāraḥ evam
translated: (The section on the questions should be elaborated in accordance with the wholesome triad.)

original: Ārammaṇādi
analyzed: ārammaṇa ādi
translated: Object, etc.

original: Uppanno nahetu dhammo uppannassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.🔽Anuppanno nahetu dhammo uppannassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.🔽Uppādī nahetu dhammo uppannassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: uppannaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppannassa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ  anuppannaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppannassa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ  uppādī na hetu dhammaḥ uppannassa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A presently arisen non-root-cause dhammā is related to a presently arisen non-root-cause dhammā as object condition.🔽A non-arisen non-root-cause dhammā is related to a presently arisen non-root-cause dhammā as object condition.🔽A presently arisen non-root-cause dhammā is related to a presently arisen non-root-cause dhammā as object condition.

original: Uppanno nahetu dhammo uppannassa nahetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: uppannaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppannassa na hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A presently arisen non-root-cause dhammā is related to a presently arisen non-root-cause dhammā as predominance condition.

original: Anuppanno nahetu dhammo uppannassa nahetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: anuppannaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppannassa na hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A future, not-having-as-its-cause-a-condition phenomenon is a condition, as predominance condition, for an arisen, not-having-as-its-cause-a-condition phenomenon.

original: Uppādī nahetu dhammo uppannassa nahetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo.🔽Uppanno nahetu dhammo uppannassa nahetussa dhammassa sahajātapaccayena paccayo … aññamaññapaccayena paccayo … nissayapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: uppādī na hetu dhammaḥ uppannassa na hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ  uppannaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppannassa na hetussa dhammassa sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: An arising, not-having-as-its-cause-a-condition phenomenon is a condition, as predominance condition, for an arisen, not-having-as-its-cause-a-condition phenomenon.🔽An arisen, not-having-as-its-cause-a-condition phenomenon is a condition, as conascence condition, … as mutuality condition, … as support condition, … as dependence condition, … as decisive-support condition, for an arisen, not-having-as-its-cause-a-condition phenomenon.

original: Anuppanno nahetu dhammo uppannassa nahetussa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: anuppannaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppannassa na hetussa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A future, not-having-as-its-cause-a-condition phenomenon is a condition, as dependence condition, for an arisen, not-having-as-its-cause-a-condition phenomenon.

original: Uppādī nahetu dhammo uppannassa nahetussa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: uppādī na hetu dhammaḥ uppannassa na hetussa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhitta
translated: An arising, not-having-as-its-cause-a-condition phenomenon is a condition, as dependence condition, for an arisen, not-having-as-its-cause-a-condition phenomenon. (In brief.)

original: Ārammaṇe tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi, sahajāte ekaṁ, aññamaññe ekaṁ, nissaye ekaṁ, upanissaye tīṇi …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi sahajāte eka aññamaññe eka nissaye eka upanissaye tīṇi pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: In the case of object, there are three; in the case of predominance, there are three; in the case of conascence, there is one; in the case of mutuality, there is one; in the case of support, there is one; in the case of dependence, there is one; in the case of decisive-support, there are three. … In the case of absence, there is one. (In brief.)

original: Nahetuyā tīṇi, naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe tīṇi
translated: In the case of not having as its cause, there are three; in the case of not having as its object, there are three. (In brief.)

original: Ārammaṇapaccayā nahetuyā tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: ārammaṇa paccayā na hetuyā tīṇi
translated: As object condition, not as root cause, there are three. (Condensed.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe tīṇi
translated: As not root cause, as object, there are three. (Condensed.)

original: 4.1.18. Atītattika, Hetuduka
analyzed: atīta ttika hetu duka
translated: … with past as the third, with root cause

original: Paccuppanno hetu dhammo paccuppannassa hetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccuppannaḥ hetu dhammaḥ paccuppannassa hetussa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A present root-cause dhamma is related to a present root-cause dhamma as root cause condition.

original: Atīto hetu dhammo paccuppannassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. Anāgato hetu dhammo paccuppannassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: atītaḥ hetu dhammo paccuppannassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo anāgataḥ hetu dhammo paccuppannassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo saṅkhitta
translated: A past root-cause dhamma is related to a present root-cause dhamma as object condition. A future root-cause dhamma is related to a present root-cause dhamma as object condition. (Condensed.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe dve, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… sahajāte ekaṁ, aññamaññe ekaṁ, nissaye
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe dve adhipatiyā tīṇi pe sahajāte eka aññamaññe eka nissaye
translated: As root cause, one; as object, two; as predominance, three. … As conascence, one; as mutuality, one; as support,

original: ekaṁ, upanissaye dve …pe… vipāke ekaṁ, indriye ekaṁ, magge ekaṁ, sampayutte ekaṁ,
analyzed: eka upanissaye dve pe vipāke eka indriye eka magge eka sampayutte eka
translated: one; as dependence, two. … As nutriment, one; as faculty, one; as path, one; as association, one;

original: atthiyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: atthiyāḥ ekam pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: as presence, one. … As non-disappearance, one. (Condensed.)

original: Nahetuyā dve, naārammaṇe dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā dve na ārammaṇe dve
translated: As not root cause, two; as not object, two. (Condensed.)

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe eka saṅkhitta
translated: As root cause, not as object, one. (Condensed.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe dve
translated: With non-cause as condition, as object, two. (Condensed.)

original: Ārammaṇa🔽Atīto nahetu dhammo paccuppannassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: ārammaṇa  atītaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ paccuppannassa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Object🔽A past non-cause dhammas is a condition, as object condition, for a present non-cause dhamma.

original: Anāgato nahetu dhammo paccuppannassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: anāgataḥ na hetu dhammaḥ paccuppannassa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A future non-cause dhamma is a condition, as object condition, for a present non-cause dhamma.

original: Paccuppanno nahetu dhammo paccuppannassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Ārammaṇe tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi, anantare ekaṁ …pe… sahajāte ekaṁ, aññamaññe ekaṁ,🔽nissaye ekaṁ, upanissaye tīṇi …pe… āsevane ekaṁ, kamme dve, vipāke ekaṁ …pe… indriye🔽ekaṁ, magge ekaṁ, sampayutte ekaṁ, atthiyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nahetuyā tīṇi, naārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: paccuppannaḥ na hetu dhammo paccuppannassa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhitta  ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi anantare ekam pe sahajāte eka aññamaññe eka  nissaye eka upanissaye tīṇi pe āsevane eka kamme dve vipāke ekam pe indriye  eka magge eka sampayutte eka atthiyā ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta  na hetuyā tīṇi na ārammaṇe tīṇi
translated: A present non-cause dhamma is a condition, as object condition, for a present non-cause dhamma. (Condensed.)

original: Ārammaṇapaccayā nahetuyā tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: ārammaṇa paccayā na hetuyā tīṇi
translated: In the section on object, there are three; in the section on predominance, there are three; in the section on proximity, there is one; … in the section on contiguity, there is one; in the section on presence, there is one; in the section on absence, there is one; in the section on disappearance, there is one; in the section on non-disappearance, there is one; in the section on arising, there is one; in the section on presence, there is one; in the section on past, there is one; in the section on future, there is one; in the section on present, there is one; in the section on non-arising, there is one; in the section on arising, there is one; in the section on non-arising, there is one; in the section on cessation, there is one; in the section on path, there is one; in the section on non-enmity, there is one; in the section on non-delusion, there is one; in the section on the seen, there is one; in the section on the directly-known, there is one; in the section on the cognized, there is one; in the section on the attained, there is one; in the section on the resolved, there is one; in the section on the investigated, there is one; in the section on the well-investigated, there is one; in the section on the developed, there is one; in the section on the unarisen unwholesome, there is one; in the section on the unarisen indeterminate, there is one; in the section on the abandoned unwholesome, there is one; in the section on the abandoned indeterminate, there is one; in the section on the ceased unwholesome, there is one; in the section on the ceased indeterminate, there is one; in the section on the past unwholesome, there is one; in the section on the past indeterminate, there is

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe tīṇi
translated: With no condition of root cause, there are three in object. (Condensed.)

original: 4.1.19. Atītārammaṇattika, Hetuduka
translated: … With past object, root cause, etc.

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Root cause🔽With a past object, a root cause condition arises with a past object.

original: Atītārammaṇaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca atītārammaṇo hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Anāgatārammaṇaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anāgatārammaṇo hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: atīta ārammaṇam hetum dhammam paṭicca atīta ārammaṇaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā  anāgata ārammaṇam hetum dhammam paṭicca anāgata ārammaṇaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a future object, a root cause condition arises with a future object.

original: Paccuppannārammaṇaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca paccuppannārammaṇo hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: paccuppanna ārammaṇam hetum dhammam paṭicca paccuppanna ārammaṇaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a present object, a root cause condition arises with a present object. (Condensed.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Naadhipatiyā tīṇi, napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, navippayutte dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  na adhipatiyā tīṇi na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na vippayutte dve
translated: With root cause, there are three; with object, there are three. … With non-hindrance, there are three. (Condensed.)

original: (Sahajātavārampi …pe… sampayuttavārampi paṭiccavārasadisaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāram pi pe sampayutta vāram pi paṭicca vāra sadisam
translated: With no predominance, there are three; with no prior, there are three; with no subsequent, there are three; with no nutriment, there are three; with no result, there are three; with no association, there are two. (Condensed.)🔽(The section on conascence, etc., should be expanded in detail as in the case of the condition by way of object.)

original: Hetu-ārammaṇa
analyzed: hetu ārammaṇa
translated: Root cause and object

translated: In the case of cause, there are three; in the case of object, nine; in the case of predominance, seven; in the case of proximity, six; in the case of contiguity, six; in the case of immediacy, six; in the case of repetition, six; in the case of kamma, six; in the case of nutriment, four; in the case of faculty, four; in the case of jhāna, four; in the case of path, four; in the case of association, three; in the case of dissociation, six; in the case of presence, six; in the case of absence, six; in the case of disappearance, six; in the case of non-disappearance, six; in the case of the requisite of purification, six; in the case of the signless, six; in the case of the desire for sensual pleasure, six; in the case of the desire for existence, six; in the case of the desire for non-existence, six; in the case of the station for consciousness, six; in the case of the station for the view of now, six; in the case of the station for the view of the past, six; in the case of the station for the view of the future, six; in the case of the station for the view of the present, six; in the case of the station for the view of the unmanifest, six; in the case of the station for the view of the manifest, six; in the case of the station for the view of the manifest and unmanifest, six; in the case of the station for the view of the non-manifest and non-unmanifest, six; in the case of the station for the view of the past, future, and present, six; in the case of the station for the view of the past, future, present, manifest, and unmanifest, six; in the case of the station for the view of the past, future, present, manifest, and unmanifest, six; in the case of the station for the view of the past, future, present, manifest, and unmanifest, six; in the case of the station for the view of the past, future, present, manifest, and unmanifest, six; in the case of the station for the view of the
