translated: With a present object …

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With a cause as condition, three. With an object as condition, three. With a predominance as condition, three. (In brief.)

original: Nahetuyā tīṇi, naadhipatiyā tīṇi, napurejāte tīṇi, napacchājāte tīṇi, naāsevane tīṇi, nakamme tīṇi, navipāke tīṇi, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge tīṇi, navippayutte dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā tīṇi na adhipatiyā tīṇi na purejāte tīṇi na pacchājāte tīṇi na āsevane tīṇi na kamme tīṇi na vipāke tīṇi na jhāne eka na magge tīṇi na vippayutte dve saṅkhitta
translated: With a non-cause as condition, three. With a non-predominance as condition, three. With a non-prenascence as condition, three. With a non-postnascence as condition, three. With a non-nutriment as condition, three. With a non-kamma as condition, three. With a non-result as condition, three. With a non-path as condition, three. With a non-non-causally-conditioned as condition, two. (In brief.)

original: (Sahajātavārampi …pe… sampayuttavārampi paṭiccavārasadisaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāram pi pe sampayutta vāram pi paṭicca vāra sadisam
translated: (The section on origination should be elaborated in the same way as the section on condition.)

original: Ārammaṇa
analyzed: ārammaṇa
translated: Object

original: Atītārammaṇo nahetu dhammo atītārammaṇassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: atīta ārammaṇaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ atīta ārammaṇassa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A non-cause dhammā with a past object is related to a non-cause dhammā with a past object as object condition. … three.

original: Anāgatārammaṇo nahetu dhammo anāgatārammaṇassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.🔽Paccuppannārammaṇo nahetu dhammo paccuppannārammaṇassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā satta, anantare satta …pe… sahajāte aññamaññe nissaye tīṇi,
analyzed: anāgata ārammaṇaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ anāgata ārammaṇassa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi  paccuppanna ārammaṇaḥ na hetu dhammo paccuppanna ārammaṇassa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi saṅkhitta  ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā satta anantare satta pe sahajāte aññamaññe nissaye tīṇi

original: upanissaye nava, āsevane tīṇi, kamme nava, vipāke …pe… sampayutte tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)

translated: In the clause on object, there are nine. In the clause on predominance, there are seven. In the clause on proximity, there are seven. … In the clause on conascence, there are seven. … In the clause on mutuality, there are seven. … In the clause on support, there are three. … In the clause on nutriment, there are three. … In the clause on faculty, there are three. … In the clause on jhāna, there are three. … In the clause on path, there are three. … In the clause on association, there are three. … In the clause on dissociation, there are three. … In the clause on presence, there are three. … In the clause on absence, there are three. … In the clause on disappearance, there are three. … In the clause on non-disappearance, there are three. … In the clause on root, there are three. … In the clause on non-cause, there are nine. … In the clause on result, there are three. … In the clause on nutriment, there are three. … In the clause on condition, there are three. … In the clause on non-deprivation, there are three. … In the clause on non-hindrance, there are three. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: In the clause on non-cause, there are nine. In the clause on non-object, there are nine. (Abbreviated.)

original: Ārammaṇapaccayā nahetuyā nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: ārammaṇa paccayā na hetuyā nava
translated: In the clause on object, there are nine in the clause on non-cause. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe nava. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe nava saṅkhitta
translated: In the clause on non-cause, there are nine in the clause on object. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvāraṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)🔽4.1.20. Ajjhattattika, Hetuduka
analyzed: yathā kusala attike pañhāvāraḥ evam
translated: … As in the case of the three wholesome kinds of consciousness, this section should be elaborated in detail.

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: With respect to internal, with respect to cause

original: Ajjhattaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ajjhatto hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: ajjhattam hetum dhammam paṭicca ajjhattaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A causally arisen internal condition is related to a causally arisen internal condition as a cause condition.

original: Bahiddhā hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca bahiddhā hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā dve, ārammaṇe dve …pe… avigate dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: bahiddhā hetum dhammam paṭicca bahiddhā hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā  hetuyā dve ārammaṇe dve pe avigate dve
translated: A causally arisen external condition is related to a causally arisen external condition as a cause condition. (Abbreviated.)🔽In the section on cause, there are two sets of two. … In the section on non-hindrance, there are two sets of two. (Abbreviated.)

original: Naadhipatiyā dve, napurejāte dve, napacchājāte dve, naāsevane dve, navipāke dve, navippayutte dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na adhipatiyā dve na purejāte dve na pacchājāte dve na āsevane dve na vipāke dve na vippayutte dve saṅkhitta
translated: In the section on non-dominance, there are two sets of two. … In the section on non-contention, there are two sets of two. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Sahajātavārampi …pe… sampayuttavārampi paṭiccavārasadisaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāram pi pe sampayutta vāram pi paṭicca vāra sadisam
translated: (The section on origination should be elaborated in the same way as the section on condition.)

original: Hetu-ārammaṇādi
analyzed: hetu ārammaṇa ādi
translated: Cause and object, etc.

original: Ajjhatto hetu dhammo ajjhattassa hetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.🔽Bahiddhā hetu dhammo bahiddhā hetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: ajjhattaḥ hetu dhammaḥ ajjhattassa hetussa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ 🔽bahiddhā hetu dhammaḥ bahiddhā hetussa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A causally arisen internal condition is related to a causally arisen internal condition as a cause condition.🔽A causally arisen external condition is related to a causally arisen external condition as a cause condition.

original: Ajjhatto hetu dhammo ajjhattassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. Ajjhatto hetu dhammo bahiddhā hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: ajjhattaḥ hetu dhammaḥ ajjhattassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ ajjhattaḥ hetu dhammaḥ bahiddhā hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A condition by way of object condition is an internal cause condition for an internal cause condition. A condition by way of object condition is an internal cause condition for an external cause condition.

original: Bahiddhā hetu dhammo bahiddhā hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. Bahiddhā hetu dhammo ajjhattassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: bahiddhā hetu dhammaḥ bahiddhā hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ bahiddhā hetu dhammaḥ ajjhattassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A condition by way of object condition is an external cause condition for an external cause condition. A condition by way of object condition is an external cause condition for an internal cause condition.

original: Ajjhatto hetu dhammo ajjhattassa hetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo.🔽Bahiddhā hetu dhammo bahiddhā hetussa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo.🔽Ajjhatto hetu dhammo ajjhattassa hetussa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: ajjhattaḥ hetu dhammaḥ ajjhattassa hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ  bahiddhā hetu dhammaḥ bahiddhā hetussa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ  ajjhattaḥ hetu dhammaḥ ajjhattassa hetussa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A condition by way of predominance condition is an internal cause condition for an internal cause condition.🔽A condition by way of predominance condition is an external cause condition for an external cause condition.🔽A condition by way of proximity condition is an internal cause condition for an internal cause condition.

original: Bahiddhā hetu dhammo bahiddhā hetussa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: bahiddhā hetu dhammaḥ bahiddhā hetussa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayo
translated: A condition by way of proximity condition is an external cause condition for an external cause condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā dve, ārammaṇe cattāri, adhipatiyā dve, anantare dve, samanantare dve, sahajāte dve, aññamaññe dve, nissaye dve, upanissaye cattāri …pe… avigate dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā dve ārammaṇe cattāri adhipatiyā dve anantare dve samanantare dve sahajāte dve aññamaññe dve nissaye dve upanissaye cattāri pe avigate dve
translated: As condition, two; as object, four; as predominance, two; as proximity, two; as contiguity, two; as decisive support, two; as dependence, two; as association, two; as dissociation, two; as presence, two; as absence, two; as disappearance, two; as non-disappearance, two; as faculty, two; as strong, two; as weak, two; as root cause, two; as nutriment, two; as source, two; as element, two; as creation, two; as base, two; as import, two; as life-continuum, two; as death, two; as rebirth-linking, two; as life-continuum, two; as adverting, two; as registration, two; as change-of-lineage, two; as path, two; as fruit, two; as nibbana, two. (In brief:) As non-deprivation, two.

original: Nahetuyā cattāri, naārammaṇe cattāri. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā cattāri na ārammaṇe cattāri
translated: As non-cause, four; as non-object, four. (In brief.)

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe dve
translated: As condition, not as object, two. (In brief.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe cattāri. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe cattāri
translated: As non-cause condition, as object, four. (In brief.)

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvāraṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: yathā kusala attike pañhāvāraḥ evam
translated: (The section is to be expanded as in the case of the wholesome triad.)

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Cause

original: Ajjhattaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ajjhatto nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: ajjhattam na hetum dhammam paṭicca ajjhattaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a causally-related internal thing as condition, an internal causally-related thing arises, as a condition being a cause.

original: Bahiddhā nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca bahiddhā nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā dve, ārammaṇe dve …pe… avigate dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: bahiddhā na hetum dhammam paṭicca bahiddhā na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā  hetuyā dve ārammaṇe dve pe avigate dve
translated: With a causally-unrelated external thing as condition, an external causally-unrelated thing arises, as a condition being a cause. (In brief.)🔽As condition, two; as object, two; … as non-disappearance, two; (in brief:) as non-deprivation, two.

original: Nahetuyā dve, naadhipatiyā dve …pe… navippayutte dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā dve na adhipatiyā dve pe na vippayutte dve
translated: As non-cause, two; as non-predominance, two; … as non-concomitance, two; (in brief:) as non-deprivation, two.

original: (Sahajātavārampi …pe… sampayuttavārampi paṭiccavārasadisaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāram pi pe sampayutta vāram pi paṭicca vāra sadisam
translated: (The section on origination should be elaborated in detail according to the method of the dependent origination.)

original: Ārammaṇa🔽Ajjhatto nahetu dhammo ajjhattassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. Ajjhatto nahetu dhammo bahiddhā nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: ārammaṇa  ajjhattaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ ajjhattassa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ ajjhattaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ bahiddhā na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Object🔽An internal base without cause is related to an internal base without cause as object condition. An internal base without cause is related to an external base without cause as object condition.

original: Bahiddhā nahetu dhammo bahiddhā nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. Bahiddhā nahetu dhammo ajjhattassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: bahiddhā na hetu dhammaḥ bahiddhā na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ bahiddhā na hetu dhammaḥ ajjhattassa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhitta
translated: An external base without cause is related to an external base without cause as object condition. An external base without cause is related to an internal base without cause as object condition. (In brief)

original: Ārammaṇe cattāri, adhipatiyā cattāri, anantare dve …pe… sahajāte aññamaññe nissaye
analyzed: ārammaṇe cattāri adhipatiyā cattāri anantare dve pe sahajāte aññamaññe nissaye
translated: Four in object condition, four in dominant condition, two in the prior condition, two in the support condition,

original: dve, upanissaye cattāri, purejāte cha, pacchājāte āsevane kamme vipāke dve, āhāre
analyzed: dve upanissaye cattāri purejāte cha pacchājāte āsevane kamme vipāke dve āhāre
translated: two in the decisive support condition, six in the prenascence condition, six in the postnascence condition, two in the nutriment condition, two in the action condition, two in the result condition,

original: cha, indriye …pe… vippayutte dve …pe… avigate cha. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: indriye pe vippayutte dve pe avigate cha saṅkhitta
translated: six in the faculty condition, two in the absence condition, two in the dissociation condition, six in the presence condition. (In brief)

original: Nahetuyā cha, naārammaṇe cha. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā cha na ārammaṇe cha saṅkhitta
translated: Six in the non-cause condition, six in the non-object condition. (In brief)

original: Ārammaṇapaccayā nahetuyā cattāri. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: ārammaṇa paccayā na hetuyā cattāri
translated: As object condition, not as root cause: four. (Condensed.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe cattāri. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe cattāri
translated: As not root cause, as object: four. (Condensed.)

original: Yathā kusalattike pañhāvāraṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.🔽4.1.21. Ajjhattārammaṇattika, Hetuduka🔽Hetu
analyzed: yathā kusala attike pañhāvāraḥ evam          hetu
translated: As in the case of the three triads on the wholesome, the section of questions should be expanded.🔽… with internal objects, with root cause.🔽Root cause

original: Ajjhattārammaṇaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ajjhattārammaṇo hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: ajjhatta ārammaṇam hetum dhammam paṭicca ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With internal objects as root cause, an internal object as root cause arises. (Condensed.)

original: Bahiddhārammaṇaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca bahiddhārammaṇo hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: bahiddhā ārammaṇam hetum dhammam paṭicca bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With external objects as root cause, an external object as root cause arises. (Condensed.)

original: Hetuyā dve, ārammaṇe dve …pe… avigate dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Naadhipatiyā dve, napurejāte dve, napacchājāte dve, naāsevane dve, navipāke dve, navippayutte dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā dve ārammaṇe dve pe avigate dve  na adhipatiyā dve na purejāte dve na pacchājāte dve na āsevane dve na vipāke dve na vippayutte dve saṅkhitta
translated: As root cause: two. As object: two. … As non-hindrance: two. (Condensed.)

original: (Sahajātavārampi …pe… sampayuttavārampi paṭiccavārasadisaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāram pi pe sampayutta vāram pi paṭicca vāra sadisam
translated: As not dominant: two. As not prenascence: two. As not postnascence: two. As not nutriment: two. As not result: two. As not decisive-support: two. As not kamma: two. As not association: two. As not presence: two. As not absence: two. As not disappearance: two. As not non-disappearance: two. (Condensed.)🔽(The section on conascence, etc., should be expanded in the same way as the section on condition.)

original: Hetu-ārammaṇa
analyzed: hetu ārammaṇa
translated: Root cause and object

original: Ajjhattārammaṇo hetu dhammo ajjhattārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.🔽Bahiddhārammaṇo hetu dhammo bahiddhārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.🔽Ajjhattārammaṇo hetu dhammo ajjhattārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena🔽paccayo. Ajjhattārammaṇo hetu dhammo bahiddhārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.🔽Bahiddhārammaṇo hetu dhammo bahiddhārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ hetu dhammaḥ ajjhatta ārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ  bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ hetu dhammaḥ bahiddhā ārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ  ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ hetu dhammaḥ ajjhatta ārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena  paccayaḥ ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ hetu dhammaḥ bahiddha ārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ  bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ hetu dhammaḥ bahiddhā ārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: A cause that has an external object is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a cause that has an external object.🔽A cause that has an internal object is a condition, as object condition, for a cause that has an internal object. A cause that has an internal object is a condition, as object condition, for a cause that has an external object.

original: paccayo. Bahiddhārammaṇo hetu dhammo ajjhattārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: paccayaḥ bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ hetu dhammaḥ ajjhatta ārammaṇassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: A cause that has an external object is a condition, as object condition, for a cause that has an external object. A cause that has an external object is a condition, as object condition, for a cause that has an internal object.

original: paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: paccayaḥ saṅkhitta
translated: (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā dve, ārammaṇe cattāri, adhipatiyā tīṇi, anantare cattāri, samanantare cattāri,
analyzed: hetuyā dve ārammaṇe cattāri adhipatiyā tīṇi anantare cattāri samanantare cattāri
translated: As root-cause, two; as object, four; as predominance, three; as proximity, four; as contiguity, four;

original: sahajāte aññamaññe nissaye dve, upanissaye cattāri, āsevane tīṇi, vipāke indriye
analyzed: sahajāte aññamaññe nissaye dve upanissaye cattāri āsevane tīṇi vipāke indriye
translated: with respect to the conascent, interrelationship, support, and decisive support conditions, there are two; with respect to the prenascent and postnascent, there are four; with respect to the conascent, there are three; with respect to the postnascent, there are two; with respect to the prenascent, there are none.

original: magge sampayutte dve …pe… avigate dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: magge sampayutte dve pe avigate dve
translated: with respect to the root cause, there are two; with respect to the path, there are two; with respect to the unities, there are two.

original: Nahetuyā cattāri, naārammaṇe cattāri. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā cattāri na ārammaṇe cattāri
translated: with respect to the non-root cause condition, there are four; with respect to the non-object condition, there are four.

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe dve
translated: with respect to the root cause condition, there are two; with respect to the non-object condition, there are two.

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe cattāri. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe cattāri
translated: with respect to the non-root cause condition, there are four; with respect to the object condition, there are four.

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvāraṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: yathā kusala attike pañhāvāraḥ evam
translated: (The section on the questions should be expanded as for the wholesome triad.)

original: Hetu🔽Ajjhattārammaṇaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ajjhattārammaṇo nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: hetu  ajjhatta ārammaṇam na hetum dhammam paṭicca ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: Root cause🔽With respect to an internal object that is not a root cause, there is an internal object that is not a root cause.

original: Bahiddhārammaṇaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca bahiddhārammaṇo nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: bahiddhā ārammaṇam na hetum dhammam paṭicca bahiddhā ārammaṇaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With respect to an external object that is not a root cause, there is an external object that is not a root cause.

original: Hetuyā dve, ārammaṇe dve …pe… avigate dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā dve ārammaṇe dve pe avigate dve
translated: with respect to the root cause, there are two; with respect to the object, there are two; with respect to the unities, there are two.

original: (Sahajātavārampi …pe… sampayuttavārampi paṭiccavārasadisaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vāram pi pe sampayutta vāram pi paṭicca vāra sadisam
translated: (The section on the conascence, … and the relation, should be expanded as for the dependent origination.)

original: Ārammaṇa
analyzed: ārammaṇa
translated: Object

original: Ajjhattārammaṇo nahetu dhammo ajjhattārammaṇassa nahetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Ārammaṇe cattāri, adhipatiyā tīṇi, anantare cattāri, sahajāte aññamaññe nissaye dve,
analyzed: ajjhatta ārammaṇaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ ajjhatta ārammaṇassa na hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhitta  ārammaṇe cattāri adhipatiyā tīṇi anantare cattāri sahajāte aññamaññe nissaye dve
translated: A mind-object condition is a condition, as object condition, for a mind-object that is not a root cause. (Abbreviated.)

original: upanissaye cattāri, āsevane tīṇi, kamme cattāri, vipāke …pe… sampayutte dve …pe…🔽avigate dve. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: upanissaye cattāri āsevane tīṇi kamme cattāri vipāke pe sampayutte dve pe  a vigate dve saṅkhitta
translated: In the section on object, there are four lines. In the section on predominance, there are three lines. In the section on proximity, there are four lines. In the section on contiguity, there are four lines. In the section on presence, there are three lines. In the section on absence, there are three lines. In the section on disappearance, there are three lines. In the section on non-disappearance, there are three lines. In the section on arising, there are three lines. In the section on presence, there are three lines. In the section on non-disappearance, there are three lines. In the section on support, there are three lines. In the section on dissociation, there are three lines. In the section on association, there are two lines. In the section on non-restraint, there are two lines. In the section on non-causality, there are four lines. In the section on object, there are four lines. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetuyā cattāri, naārammaṇe cattāri. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Ārammaṇapaccayā nahetuyā cattāri. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyā cattāri na ārammaṇe cattāri  ārammaṇa paccayā na hetuyā cattāri
translated: In the section on object condition, there are four lines in the section on non-causality. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe cattāri. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe cattāri
translated: In the section on non-causality condition, there are four lines in the section on object. (Abbreviated.)

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvāraṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)🔽4.1.22. Sanidassanasappaṭighattika, Hetuduka
analyzed: yathā kusala attike pañhāvāraḥ evam  sani dassana sa paṭigha ttika hetu duka
translated: (The question section should be expanded as in the case of the wholesome triad.)🔽... with object, with impingement, root cause

original: Anidassanaappaṭighaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anidassanaappaṭigho hetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: anidassana appaṭigham hetum dhammam paṭicca anidassana appaṭighaḥ hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A root-cause that is not-in-visible and not-impacting is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a root-cause that is not-in-visible and not-impacting. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka saṅkhitta
translated: As condition, one … As object, one … As condition and as object, one. (In brief.)

original: (Sahajātavārampi …pe… sampayuttavārampi paṭiccavārasadisaṁ.)
analyzed: sahajāta vārampi pe sampayutta vārampi paṭicca vāra sadisa
translated: (The section on origination should be elaborated in the same way as the section on condition.)

original: Anidassanaappaṭigho hetu dhammo anidassanaappaṭighassa hetussa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.🔽Anidassanaappaṭigho hetu dhammo anidassanaappaṭighassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: anidassana appaṭighaḥ hetu dhammaḥ anidassana appaṭighassa hetussa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ  anidassana appaṭighaḥ hetu dhammo anidassana appaṭighassa hetussa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo saṅkhitta
translated: A non-evident, impingent condition is a cause for a non-evident, impingent condition that is a cause.🔽A non-evident, impingent condition is a cause for a non-evident, impingent condition that is a cause. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Sabbattha ekaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā eka ārammaṇe ekaṃ pe avigate eka sabbattha eka
translated: As condition, one … As object, one … As condition and as object, one. (Everywhere, one.)

original: (Yathā kusalattike pañhāvāraṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: yathā kusala attike pañhāvāraḥ evam
translated: (The question section should be elaborated in detail as in the case of the wholesome triad.)

original: Hetu-ārammaṇa
analyzed: hetu ārammaṇa
translated: Cause and object

original: Anidassanasappaṭighaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anidassanasappaṭigho nahetu dhammo🔽uppajjati hetupaccayā. Anidassanasappaṭighaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sanidassanasappaṭigho
analyzed: anidassana sappaṭigham na hetum dhammam paṭicca anidassana sappaṭighaḥ na hetu dhammo 🔽uppajjati hetu paccayā anidassana sappaṭigham na hetum dhammam paṭicca sa nidassana sappaṭighaḥ
translated: A non-evident, impingent condition that is not a cause …

original: nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Anidassanasappaṭighaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca🔽anidassanaappaṭigho nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
